author: {'steamid': '76561197967976610', 'num_games_owned': 1387, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 2752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1624877835}
review:
Wait until under $5 (AU), I've owned this game originally on my PSVita (original release and refresh version, US account), at the end of the day it is more about wasting time then being an enjoyable rpg/dungeon crawling game.  Progression is behind a farming/luck wall, given that you'll be farming an area over and over to get enough xp/armour/weapons to be able to progress the story and hope you don't run into impossible battles at a lower level area. Unfortunately the equivalent of D&D/Ultima/Wizardry/Might & Magic are no longer being made in a decent form. (Most that are made are $$$ grabbing DLC farmers)

Beware of "Saviors of Sapphire Wings / Stranger of Sword City Revisited";(Revisited should be a free copy for original owners), very likely to be another money grab for older un-ported ex-console games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988040892', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1599958744}
review:
Now I've barely played the game at this point but there is a lot to like about it. First the art is amazing, everything seems to be voice acted (albeit in japanese) and the combat seems deep enough to be a challenge. It's an older RPG dungeon crawler where you move around a small map square by square, encounter enemies, level up and get stronger. I can tell you that most of these kind of RPG's are grindy. Not in a bad way if you like that kind of thing, mind you, but some people tend to like a more streamlined linear RPG where the story gives you enough XP to progress naturally. I like working for it so this game is up my alley.

My literal only nitpick about this game is that none of the audio options seems to actually do anything. I turn the audio totally off for the background music but it still plays at the same level constantly and the sound effects and voices are still at default despite the bar being turned to OFF. Annoying because I like to listen to podcasts while I play games but whatever. 

For as little as I paid for it ($3.99) I feel like I got a heck of a deal. I'd even say this is worth it for the 20 dollar price tag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068360744', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1138, 'last_played': 1667588531}
review:
O nome do jogo é FARM, camarada.
Dungeon crawler excelente, com ilustrações belíssimas e mulheres mais ainda. Temática envolvente e história cativante e misteriosa. O problema é que a trama se desenvolve BEM lentamente já que você vai precisar subir bastante de nível a cada novo desafio. Usa-se MUITO um sistema de farm onde você arma emboscadas para saquear baús que generais inimigos carregam pelas dungeons. Se você tiver bastante tempo pra jogar e curte o gênero dungeon crawler, é jogo obrigatório.

author: {'steamid': '76561198813243843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1416, 'last_played': 1616587139}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198027063266', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1119, 'last_played': 1597543724}
review:
What can i say it mixes all the worst principles of NIS titles such as endless grinding to make progress, trash item rich world, and repeating the same area over and over again until your eyes bleed. With the absolute worst mechanics of a rogue lite like perma death for your hired npc's, paired with instant kill attacks with multiple hits and each hit can kill you. An absolutely nonsensical defensive stat availability, and lastly a very specific set of class abilities from multiclassing forever to get a character that wont instantly implode in any boss fight.. This game at most times is in fact a torture simulator.

The game is literally built on you taking characters you make and leveling them into oblivion to make them functional with incredibly slow xp gain outside very risky fights. every time you want to walk into a new zone, the amount you ground instantly becomes irrelevant as you need the gear from inside the new area to survive the new area. After you go through this process about 2-3 times and start permanently losing characters you have spent literal days in game time building up.

The defensive options are so stupid, its almost entirely based on evasion and hit, every non magic character basically has to rush 25 agi to hit anything even equipping + hit weapons on most classes will give you about a 30% hitrate. i have a character with 63 defense that takes less damage than my 79 defense character. And theres basically no way to preotect against magic damage until after its killed about 25 characters.

All in all its an RNG fest with terrible game mechanics that dont matchup to a fun experience. Normally with NIS i would power through because they have sometimes some very amazing stories like Disgai. but this game is almost devoid of any story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058219816', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 5192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4920, 'last_played': 1619808465}
review:
思考錯誤が楽しめる玄人向けの3DダンジョンRPG

難易度選択ではノーマルとイージーが用意されているけど、ゲームとしての難易度はとてもハード。
公式マニュアルにも心が折れた時は・・という項目があるくらい。

デフォルトで快適な戦闘高速化ボタンや踏地済への高速移動などが用意されているので
ストレスなくレベリングができるのが良い。（それでもクリアに70時間かかってますが）

「女神転生やダンジョントラベラーズはヌルゲーだったんだ」と思わせるような難易度のゲームでしたが、選択肢の豊富な戦闘・群を抜いている良質BGM・ハクスラ要素・世界観など楽しめる要素が満載なので迷っている人はプレイしてみて欲しい。

author: {'steamid': '76561198042872833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2917, 'last_played': 1594991032}
review:
・キャラクターデザインが好き。
思いっきりアニメ調な絵よりも、若干リアルよりな絵…PSのジルオール等が好きなので。
（普通にアニメ調なのも収録されています。）
・3Dダンジョン系が好き。
ウィザードリィや、女神転生シリーズ…古いのだと、日本テレ〇ットのデスブリンガー等が好きなので。
と。いう理由でセールで購入。Lv15で序盤の終了時点での感想です。
ゲームの難易度を上げたかったんだと思いますが、少し面倒に思えてしまうシステム。
店でアイテムを購入しても補充されません。売っても、店に並びませんｗ
アイテムは、敵を待ち伏せして奪え。といことです。
店は、余分なアイテムを売るだけになっていて機能してません。
回復アイテム数を持ち過ぎると、敵がやたらと強く攻撃とか当たらなくなります。
多分、序盤からお金MAXとかのチート対策とかしてると思います。（キャラを2人作り比べてみました）
難易度ビギナーとノーマルの差が、もっと明確に欲しかった。
キャラクターのスキル値の上限は各種族の基本+20です。2週目からは99まで上がるそうですが、ビギナーの場合は99まで上がるとか、店に売った物が並ぶとかの差ぐらいは有ったら良かったと思います。
セール等で購入する以外は、オススメしません。

author: {'steamid': '76561198383577446', 'num_games_owned': 6208, 'num_reviews': 499, 'playtime_forever': 1272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1657174426}
review: 剑之街异邦人听名字就感觉不一般。画风很黑暗。女主穿着校服穿越异世界很诡异。城堡里互动选项非常多。我觉得那个选队友界面像抽卡牌一样的挺美观的。虽然也是走原始的迷宫探索RPG路线。但敌人有点难对付，怪物造型也都是挺奇葩的.有个NPC立绘超像真田幸村。全程是有日语配音的，但这个画风实在太欧美了。没有官中没继续深入。感觉是不错的游戏，留个脚印。有机会好好玩玩

author: {'steamid': '76561198051384139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 4200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1106, 'last_played': 1590037237}
review:
Very solid RPG.  I like it much better than Elminage the Original.
Pro:  
Good art work (also customizable portraits).
Six member party with lots of options.
Interesting story.
The puzzels are mostly interesting and not ridiculously hard like some other games.
Multiple endings.
Con:
Translation is pretty bad.
Shop items does not respawn.
Some gears are hard to find.
Lots grinding.
Crits = instant death.
Some bosses are ridiculously hard.
Definitely worth a try especially on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198221333752', 'num_games_owned': 441, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 11793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11309, 'last_played': 1653620133}
review:
人を選ぶもののハマればかなりの時間を奪う良いゲームです。
Wizardry系DRPGの経験のある人にはオススメしますが、そうでない人にはおすすめできません。
少なくともこの種のゲームは初めてという人はクリア後ボス攻略の実績解除率が3.4%という事実を踏まえた上でプレイすべきでしょう。

最終的にはキャラクタービルドに幅が出ないとか最強装備堀りのためには狂った強さの敵と戦い続けなければいけないといった問題はあるし、説明不足なところも多々ありますがオーソドックスなDRPGに便利機能を追加したようなシステムなので経験者なら問題なくプレイできるでしょう。
なお、他の方が指摘されている通り黒の宮殿と銘打ってあるものの中身はXBOX版の白の王宮ベースなのでVita版の新釈・黒の宮殿をプレイできる環境ならそちらのほうが良いかもしれません。

私は神村正掘りで心が折れました。

review: Insane, je cherchais un dungeon crawler de qualité et je suis ravie. Pour avoir jouer à labyrinth of refrain: coven of dusk, je pensais pas retomber sur un aussi bon dungeon crawler. Contrairement à ce que j'ai pu lire le jeux n'est pas si difficile (du moins pour l'insant, et je suis à 21h de jeux). De plus de nombreux système facilite l'exploration des donjons. La créations des personnages est vraiment plaisante, franchement je recommande !

author: {'steamid': '76561198015901278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2332, 'last_played': 1588158691}
review: ตอนเล่นแรกๆ  มันก็สนุกอยู่หรอก แต่พอเล่นไปสักพักก็เจอระบบที่น่ารำคาญคือ มันจำกัดจำนวนครั้งในการตาย โดยตัวละครที่เราสร้างจะมีจำนวนการตายได้ 1-3 ครั้ง    การตายครั้งนึงของตัวนึง เราต้องเล่นในเกมประมาณ 30-60 นาที เพื่อฟิ้นมันหรือจะใช้ไอเท็มราคาแพง หรือจ่ายเงินราคาโหดมากไม่มีทางหรอกที่ผู้เล่นจะมีเงินขนาดนั้นในช่วงต้นเกม และการตายแม้จะฟิ้นด้วยวิธีข้างต้นแล้วมันจะไปลด ค่าจำกัดจะนวนครั้งในการตาย ถ้าหมดคือตัวนั้นตายถาวรเลย   ค่าตายจำนวนจำกัดนี้สามารถเพิ่มกลับมาได้ด้วยการใช้คำสั่งให้มันพักฟื้น รอประมาณ 5-6 ชม. ในเกม[ต้องเล่นไม่สามารถเปิดเกมทิ้งไว้รอเวลาได้]    มันค่อนข้างน่ารำคาญในระบบแบบนี้  เพราะมอนสเตอร์ทั่วๆ ไปในเกม มีโอกาสตีเราตายในทีเดียว HP คุณจะเท่าไหร่ไม่สน พอเจอทีต้องเปลี่ยนตัวละครอื่นมาเล่นเพื่อรอเวลา ช่วงนั้นถ้าซวยอีกเจอตีตายอีก 1-2 คน ก็แทบหมดอารมณ์เลย load save ลูกเดียว

author: {'steamid': '76561198052351115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1633525092}
review:
>87h de jeu (offline). Pas fini encore la 1ère partie.

Dessins,ambiance,musique pas mal du tout je trouve.

Par contre: "difficulté" totalement s-t-u-p-i-d-e. 
Dommage mais jeu vraiment trop frustrant.

Hyper aléatoire avec la très grande majorité des boss qui ont 98% de chance de oneshot n'importe lequel de vos personnage à chaque attaque quel que soit les stats/niveaux.....absurde et punitif .
Sans compter la mort permanente des persos créés si on ne les envois pas 10h à l'hopital dès que KO.
Ce qui vous met vite au chômage faute d'équipe sur pied.
Ceci pour masquer un manque d'imagination des DEV? Je n'appel pas "ça" difficile, juste mal équilibré/testé.

A réserver pour du casual gaming et que pour les grooos amateurs de jeux de rôle tour par tour.
A jouer 20 /30 mn pas plus à chaque fois puisque à 999% c'est du grind d'XP et de matériel sinon impossible de gagner.

Je vais le terminer (après sans doute 15h de grind d'exp en plus...) mais c'est dommage la difficulté doit être revue.

Peut être la 2e version améliorée sortie en 2e temps sur Vita corrige ces problème? 
Aucune idée, les joueurs PC ont été oubliés pour cette version corrigée...

author: {'steamid': '76561198018559118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5934, 'last_played': 1583104299}
review: This game is hard, like sometimes really hard if you do not want anyone to die at all. But it is fun and don't be afraid to hospitalize your party, just make an additional set of temporary party members and you'll do good. Also, a good tank is the key to most battles. Overal I'd say its a good dungeon crawler so if you enjoy the genre, you should get this. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198215857911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1582191829}
review: I felt the controls of this game were ment for a console and thus were rather janky for a pc user. The art style is amazing and really apreciate the effort of it. However thats where it ends. The game sets itself as a dnd in VN style which I like but the fight mechanics are confusing and you must confirm EVERYTHING EVERY TIME. And thus I did not finish the game due to such an annoying mechanic that I cannot stand the least.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054049374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7312, 'last_played': 1581068178}
review:
ダンジョンの探索→詰まったら待ち伏せの繰り返しですが、
待ち伏せでレベリングしつつ装備を集める楽しみがあるので、
自分のように作業大好きな人にはオススメ。そうでないと微妙。

ストアページを見ると洋ゲーのような「濃い」絵柄に目に行きますが、
NPCはオプションで日本っぽい感じの可愛い絵柄に変更できますし、
自キャラのポートレートなんかも可愛いものがたくさん用意されてるので、
絵柄で敬遠するのは少々もったいないかも。

author: {'steamid': '76561198004423189', 'num_games_owned': 4454, 'num_reviews': 423, 'playtime_forever': 6058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6058, 'last_played': 1574024580}
review:
Эту игру я могу порекомендовать только отъявленным мазохистам, минмаксерам и людям, которым по большому счёту некуда девать своё время. Нет, она не то, чтобы _совсем_ плоха. А за идею с автоматическим перемещением по карте я был готов простить ей очень многое. Но не всё. В общем - по порядку.

Начало игры выглядит просто замечательно: есть мои любимые донжоны с видом от первого лица и перемещением по клеточкам, есть твоя группа, которую можно набирать по вкусу, есть тонны оборудования... правда, есть и одна неприятная деталь. Которую, по всей видимости сами авторы игры считают главной особенностью. Перманентная смерть любых персонажей, кроме главного героя.

Нет, пока не спешите убегать: перманентно они умирают не сразу. Любой персонаж получает от одного до трёх "сердец"-жизней, которые теряются при смерти, и как только кончатся все - вот тут-то персонаж и исчезает навсегда. Впрочем, их можно восстанавливать отдыхом на базе, поэтому поначалу кажется, что всё не так уж плохо.

Вот только монстры, способные внезапно убить кого угодно, поначалу встречаются на каждом шагу. И отлечиваться придётся часто. А местное время считается... в хитпойнтах убитых монстров. Убил какую-нибудь шваль - на базе прошло пять минут. Завалил босса - полдня. А одно сердце восстанавливается неделю.

В общем, вы поняли: вас ждёт гринд, гринд и ещё раз гринд. Игра, впрочем, этого особо и не скрывает: новое оборудование падает не с любых монстров, а с "караванов", которые надо подкарауливать в определённых точках карты. И таких там точек - две-три. А за один заход на карту можно их использовать буквально один-два раза. Поэтому приготовьтесь к многократному повторению цикла "подкараулил монстров - убил монстров - сходил на базу, поменял оборудование и подлечился". На этом этапе я почти игру бросил.

Впрочем, после определённого уровня персонажей стало не так уж плохо: много перманентных заклинаний, улучшающих характеристики, много маны для обычных заклинаний, персонажи, что не падают от одного чиха, новые умения, синергии, хорошее оборудование, предметы, которые позволяют избежать многих проблем, в том числе смерти - середина игры тянет на твёрдую четвёрку, и я уж было начал считать её вполне хорошим, годным гриддером, ну только что с плохим началом.

А потом начались высокоуровневые монстры, и всё опять стало плохо, потому что опять всё свелось к превозмоганию. Толстые монстры, которые убивают с одного захода, требуют весьма специфических скиллов (гринд), весьма немаленьких уровней персонажа (тут по тебе больно бьёт та самая классная синергия классов, которая, к сожалению, сбрасывает уровень персонажа при каждой смене - и опять гринд), и всё равно уничтожают персонажей своими специальными умениями. Которые нивелируются, конечно, специальными предметами - только предметы исчезают, магазин не обновляется, и для их добычи тебе опять-таки нужен гринд. Гринд я упомянул, кстати?

В общем, я некоторое время попревозмогал, и прошёл (судя по дереву скиллов) почти весь сюжет, но в парящей башне мне встретился мини-босс, который имеет порядка 12 атак. Дважды за ход. И это сносит любые защиты, а заодно и тех, кто их ставит. Неет, понятно, что надо ещё погриндить, ещё поменять классы на нужные, опять погриндить, чтобы догнать персонажей до нормальной кондиции, и тогдаа, наверняка, я смогу этого несчастного босса прибить.

Но блин, это уже сто часов потрачено. Тратить ещё двадцать-тридцать на эту вот прокачку? А потом встретить следующего босса, с другими спецатаками? Да ну его нафиг.

В общем, я оцениваю игру в целом баллов на 60, наверное, а тому, кто _любит_ всю эту прокачку и скиллы в ущерб прогрессу, так и на все 80 - но большинству людей я точно её не порекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198951726633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 611, 'last_played': 1579708521}

author: {'steamid': '76561198112838066', 'num_games_owned': 1428, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 3018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3018, 'last_played': 1580326572}
review:
Let me start by saying I am absolutely in love with this game despite all its massive flaws and infuriating dificulty wall (because calling it a curve or even a cliff did not feel quite right).

I was originally planning to recommend it despite those flaws and to try and explain them/how to best deal with them... But then I found out there exists an updated re-release of this game that fixes most of my issues with the game, fixes the difficulty issues and adds a lot of new content; But unfortunately that re-release is a PSvita exclusive, with seemingly no plans for it to ever get a PC release.

I'd honestly just say to wait for a possible PC release of it, even if it never comes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268108561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1579367991}
review:
Pros:
+Art and visuals
+Custom Character feature
+Dungeon Crawling mechanics

Cons:
-Dialogue (very bland, and it goes on forever. Could easily shrink two paragraphs of dialogue into two meaningful sentences)
-UI (combat options are clunky compared to others of this genre (especially Shin Megami Tensei), and the message bar is on top of the screen, so you're either reading text, or looking at numbers, and not both)

After about an hour of boredom(Dialogue)/frustration(from UI), I got a refund and played SMT4 instead. This has great potential, but needs a QoL update.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153043921', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 9453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9176, 'last_played': 1611378587}
review:
友人から死の緊張感があるゲームだと聞き購入したが、Wizardry1～3ほどは難しくない。
ダンジョンによっては”理不尽な程強い雑魚”がいたりするが、キャラごとに生命点（死亡しても復活できる回数）があり、
その生命点も回復する事ができる点で、気にかけておけばWizのように灰になってロストという事もないので易しい。
好きなタイミングで好きな職業に転職できるのも易しいと感じた要員。
帰還すれば無料で全回復するのも易しいし、自動移動も楽ちん。

序盤は特に苦戦するが、VIT上げを優先してればなんとかなる。余力を残した探索を。
補助スキルは重ね掛け有効なものが多い。神気スキルも積極的に使っていこう。

種族によって通る攻撃と通らない攻撃が顕著なのは面白かった。
これにより、どれだけレベルが上がろうとも確認をせずオート戦闘を行うと気づいたら死亡という事も・・・
アタッカー、盾、ヒーラー、敵種族に応じた攻撃方法を得るためのパーティ編成とスキル構成、装備を考えるなければ先には進みにくい。

装備の強化値が高いものをひたすら探しに行くのが楽しいと思えるハック＆スラッシュ好きなら（序盤で投げ出さなければ）買って損はしないと思う。

author: {'steamid': '76561197961131873', 'num_games_owned': 1029, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 1714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1632, 'last_played': 1601967284}
review:
Good, solid blobber.  I didn't think I liked these kind of games any more but I keep getting drawn back to this whenever I have the urge just to level up a little and get a little farther.

What's different about this game?

[list][*]"Lineages"
The purpose of the game is to hunt "lineages", meaning big, unique monsters.*  The twist here is that each lineage has its own little story and place in the world, which means you aren't just wandering around hoping one will appear.  Some live in certain places, some can be lured out with the use of a certain item, and, yes, some [i]do[/i] just wander around certain areas as random encounters.  As a result, the game feels more like a hunt than an exercise in filling in the maps.

* Not to be confused with the English word lineage.  This has nothing to do with genealogy.

[*] Ambushes.

You can set up your own ambushes to get great loot.  In every dungeon, there are opportunities to hunt 'transporters', special enemies that carry treasure chests.  Each chest will carry an item of a certain type and quality that you can see before starting the fight, so you might hide and wait for an enemy carrying a Gold chest with Armor in it.  Then you have to beat the 'transporter' in a short time or they will escape with the loot.  This is a fun time sink for building up your party's gear, and finding new and more lucrative ambush spots is a satisfying form of progress.

[*] The Revive/Recover system and fluid party builds.

Instead of a single set party, you will have a "stable" of up to 16 characters.  When a character is downed, they don't just stand up again at the end of a fight, or get rezzed at the temple for a few gold pieces.  Instead, you take them back to base for a long recovery period, forcing you to use alternate characters in the meantime.  This sounds punishing, but it actually makes things more fun as it gives you incentive and opportunity to mix up your party composition.  This is made even more interesting by having a party size of only 6, but 8 character classes.  Is a Ninja a good substitute for a Dancer?  Because my Dancer got knocked out.  What if my Fighter and my Samurai got knocked out so I have to substitute a Knight and a Ranger on my front line for a while instead?  Will that work?  It's neat.

[*] Character customization.

Lastly, the game has a built-in function to import your own .png files to use for your party.  No need to use elaborate mods or follow a guide to hack the file system, just add your images.  For a customization hound like me this really adds to my attachment to the party.[/list]
I got the game on sale for $9 and have about 30 hours so far.  (I am [b]far[/b] from finished.)  I'd say this is easily worth full price $20, and on sale it's a very good investment.  It won't completely blow your mind but again is a good solid game with some nice new features to liven up the classic blobber gameplay.  Do yourself a favor and grab it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214391935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 627, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1579099931}
review:
[quote]
Stranger of Sword City（剑之街的异邦人）是由Experience制作的一款地城迷宫探索RPG，即大家俗称的DRPG，大致讲述了主角因为空难事故而误入了一个充斥着迷宫和魔物的奇妙异世界，作为这个世界的异邦人，为了生存下去更为了回到原本的世界，不得不选择了战斗。

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1969671126

[quote]
[h1]游戏的考据&科普：[/h1]
株式会社Experience是由Michaelsoft的前任员工设立的一个日本RPG游戏开发社兼游戏发行商，主要在DRPG游戏方面制作非常有名气，就比如本作的《剑之街的异邦人》，与《圆桌之生徒》、《Demon Gaze》（恶魔凝视）和《Ray Gigant》（神依骑士）几部作品采用了相同的世界观，圆桌之生徒世界观。而本社另外几部比较有名的《爱丽丝奏鸣曲曲》，《迷宫xBlood：无限》，《东京新世录》系列则采用了三者通用的XE世界观。

本作很有意思的是在版本方面和别的游戏相比较有些不同，在日版的Xbox 360上于2014年6月5日最先发售，当时标题名为《剣の街の异邦人：白の王宫》（剑之街的异邦人：白之王宫），PC版于2014年8月22日登录与Xbox 360版本相同，而在2015年1月22日上发布的PSV版本则叫做《剣の街の异邦人：黒の宫殿》。黑白宫殿两个版本之间多多少少有些许不同之处，讨伐的血统种和一周目结束后刷新的迷宫等等方面，值得一提的是黒の宫殿的版本更是灵活运用了PSV的技能，配合了触摸控制等独有机能，但总归大体还都是一样的内容。
[/quote]

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1969671251

[quote]
[h1]游戏的体验和分析：[/h1]
游戏在一开始时通过开头动画向我们展现了一小段背景设定，从中我们可以非常明显的看出在欧式画风下塑造的异世界风格，略偏暗的浓墨色调稍微透露出一股阴森恐怖的氛围，这样的设定让我稍微联想到了一点《剑风传奇》（Berserk）的背景画风，同时在场景中还能看到电视、飞机残骸和手机等现代科技产物，奇幻异世界和现代产物的遗骸巧妙的结合在了一起，再加上较为诡异的魔物结合在一起，把一个异世界的浓厚氛围渲染的惟妙惟肖。

开始游戏后，本作为玩家提供了一个较为简单的捏人系统，需要玩家在预设好的范围内捏角色，包括角色的立绘、属性值、职业，甚至语言等，其中立绘的风格相差较大，你可以选择已经日系萌化的小可爱，也可以选择欧美风粗狂的线条，乃至还有非常具有RPG色彩的经典立绘，当然如果你不满意也可以自行设置（不过转念一想，在这种欧美风格的画风中突然钻出一个二次元萌系脑袋，怎么想都很出戏啊......）。本作在场景的动态效果上做的还是非常用心的，不论是在迷宫外风沙的飘动还是在迷宫内开门时砾石的掉落，在这些细节方面都做了较好的还原。同时在CG方面也制作的相当精美，甚至可以说有一种油画的唯美感了，可惜战斗中却没有战斗画面比较敷衍。

既然作为一款DRPG，那么主要的玩法就是需要玩家在迷宫内探索，因此也继承了DRPG游戏最大的两个弊端，即迷宫与怪物素材重复率极高和需要花费大量的时间去体验刷刷刷的内容，不过值得夸奖的是在探索时右上角自带的小地图会把走过的路都标记出来，玩家们也不必再担心反复走进死胡同了，同时在画面的表现感上确实非常上乘，一开始带来的惊喜和满足感还是比较持久的。好在迷宫数不多，一共十个，着急体验剧情的玩家可以选择简单模式少点刷刷刷内容。

在玩法方面，本作在生命点上比较苛刻，死亡代价很大，死亡后有扣点数惩罚，生命点扣完那这个角色就玩完了，准备后事吧。因此上来据说好像主角无限生命点？但是非常菜，所以上来给你的大佬队友是让你熟悉防御的，不要之后什么事全靠莽。另外进城之后可以招募新的队友，不推荐系统给的菜狗队友，自己直接创建新队友，然后重新Roll骰子分配属性点，这个非常看脸，特定的职业有特定的属性需求，如忍者看敏捷、战士看力量，再加上队伍中不同角色的搭配，不同的行动也会招致不同的结果，这样算下来本作在这几个系统的组合搭配上还是异常丰富的。
[/quote]

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1969671301

[quote]
[h1]最终总结：[/h1]
Stranger of Sword City（剑之街的异邦人）作为一款传统的DRPG来说，整体内容的质量极佳，不论是精致的画面和独具特色的风格，还是丰富的玩法系统和硬核的刷图体验，都非常巧妙的结合在了一起，相辅相成互相提升，只不过也继承了DRPG重复率高和过度刷刷刷的一贯弊端。本作推荐给喜欢风格独特的DRPG玩家，对于不习惯硬核刷刷刷的玩家还请谨慎考虑。
[/quote]
[/quote]
[quote]
游玩百态，将游玩心得用汉语化作玩家的指明灯，(๑•̀ㅂ•́)و✧
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/35402408/]点击这里关注汉化语录~[/url] 如果喜欢这个评测，请点个赞让更多人看见
[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198059617418', 'num_games_owned': 1206, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 2128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2128, 'last_played': 1579018893}
review:
win10だけど今の所一度もクラッシュしていません

待ち伏せして良いアイテム狙ってボス倒しての繰り返しでつまんない

ダンジョンの途中でショートカット出来るようになるがゲームを進めていると倒したボスが復活してショートカットが使えなくなる
使えるようにするにはまたボスを倒さないといけない
クソだりいバカ

即死攻撃などでちょいちょい死ぬんだけどデメリットがデカすぎて萎える

主人公は復活実質無料だが金が溜まってくると強制的に回収される
これのせいで金が貯まらん

アイテムの値段が高すぎる

セーブが街でしか出来ない

オプションでいじった画面サイズが毎回起動するたび初期化される

author: {'steamid': '76561197967471651', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 32072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1702570931}
review:
Awesome game made for fans of the genre as it's quite challenging with no hand-holding at all.

The basic gameplay is you create a team of 6 adventurers who set out to explore a mostly open ended series of dungeons teeming with all sorts of secrets and nasties, alongside some unique and interesting gameplay mechanics such as your characters setting up ambushes for the enemies. Your team can be changed at any time as you maintain a retinue of up 12 characters. 

There's lots of little tools and features in the game to make dungeon exploration and combat more pleasant. The dungeon is automapped and also features a quick move system where you simply select a point on the map and can have your party start hauling arse over there. Combat also features the ability to speed through a round or to auto-repeat the previous turn's actions, including in between battles.

Character creation is interesting with a whole lot of room for creativity. Your character can swap classes (of which there are 8) up to 6 times letting him mix and match skills from whatever classes you want. A ranger can do some strong ranged damage from the backrow to single enemies. A samurai can slash a whole group at once. Combine them together and you have a samuanger attacking everybody at once from the backrow. New characters you create during your adventure will also start at a level proportional to your hero instead of 0, so therer's no real concern about creating a screwed up character. Send them to the executioner and bring in the new recruit!

The game features a pseudo-permadeath system that provides real consequences. Characters have up to 3 hearts. When they die they lose one heart and need to be revived at town. You can either pay more than than you have for this to be done instantly or wait for a certain amount of 'time' which is just battles. You can then restore that character's hearts, after they revive, for *far* more money than you have to have it happen instantly, or let them rest to restore them over time for, similarly, way more time. If they die when they have only 1 heart then pseudo-permadeath becomes simply permadeath. Your main character is the exception to this who can die as much as you like with no risk of permadeath or removal from the party - the chosen and all that.

The system lets you ensure you never *have* to face a perma-death, but it makes failure in combat have much greater consequences than the typical 'use fly back to town item' + 'heal team for a pittance' + 'go back stronger than ever' pattern. 

If you enjoy wizardry-like games, you'll probably love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081711959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1578769928}
review:
I posted a fairly thorough review of the game and steam some how lost it, and I don't feel like re-writing that mess..

I want to preface this review with stating that I am a fan of first person dungeon crawler games, dating back to the 80's and 90's. Love the genre.. that being said....

 Basically I felt this game tried to do some new things for the genre and they fell flat of what could have been achieved. Also I didn't like the artwork style clashes, and I realize you can import portraits as well and that was cool.

 Ambushing is a boring slog, and serves as the main way of getting gear improvements. It is boring. You know it is boring now. That is all.

 Character creation is worse than un-modded Wizardry VI, (I didn't feel that was too bad but many did), and there is even a guide here on steam that talks you through setting up an auto-roller program to roll your characters for you. It's that intensely boring and mind-numbing. You can pick from a list of "talents" to kind of individualize characters but it's typically "safe" to just choose the talent that gives you a few more bonus points to allocate to your stats. Age helps you with the minimum points you'd get on character creation, the higher the age of the character, the better bonus point roll you receive, with the trade off that you get less "hearts" or "lives". If a character dies, a heart is removed from them, it can regenerate over time, but once they lose all their hearts they are permanently gone. Perma-death does not bother me, but this might be a stop point for many, so be aware it is possible.

 The lore is there, but it's bad. Real bad. And I never at any point found myself caring about any NPC in any way shape or form, at all. The translation is bad, but not as bad as say Elminage Original (which I found many times more entertaining than this game btw), and I also did not care for the music either. This game just was not exciting for me, and really didn't motivate me to find out what happens next.. it just.. blegh.. blandly hobbled along for the short time I played it.

 I really don't feel like re-writing everything I originally wrote about this game, so I'll just end this with saying Stranger of Sword City is an extremely boring experiment of sorts. It tried to do new things, which I can appreciate, but it just failed incredibly at getting me interested in it. It is sad because I wanted find something I could enjoy about it, but just couldn't get myself invested in it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133711616', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 4642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3281, 'last_played': 1589858173}
review:
this game is unpolished gem.
good music, cool art and design.
unexpectedly this game have a very good dark and gloomy story despite all of the main casts is high-schooler.
the only part drag down this game is actually the gameplay. gameplay is unique and fun but it's too grindy and waste too much time which make you ultimately just skipping all fights for the sake of quick grind. there is a random overpowered encountered which insta-kill you if you are not careful while skipping fights. horrible and punishing level design.

overall this game is good but if you don't like DRPG game you should never buy this. you won't survive the grind.

my personal favorite. one of the few series which i love to buy if there is any sequel of it.

edit : looks like there is a lot better version on ps vita. buy vita version instead if you have the console
more edit : revisited version bundled with savior of sapphire wings available on steam. go get that instead

author: {'steamid': '76561198052234570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1277, 'last_played': 1578328563}
review:
The game has a great visual design, interesting monsterdesigns and overall fun dungeon layout. I really enjoyed playing it until now.

It's just one minor thing that sucked the fun out of it for me: the way the permadeath is handled in this game. Aside from very few items that can revive your characters, each death that happens will lose you a lot of real world time. For a character to revive and recover you have to fight 50+ fights without him/her. And you can only save outside the dungeon, so resetting inside the dungeon is impossible without losing progress.
Pair that with the fact that some enemies can get critical hits that just outright kill a character without a check for HP or defence, you feel like you're constantly at the mercy of a dieroll to lose an hour or more of your time with each fight.

Yes, not all enemies can instakill you, and there are ways to avoid it, but those are very roundabout (choosing a trait at character-creation, would mean you ignore all other ones; or casting a divinity each turn in fights with enemies that might crit you, meaning a) you can't use any other divinity and b) you'd have to look up first which enemies can crit you or learn by trial-and-error).

It's really a very solid game; I had fun playing it. It's a pity this single mechanic really ruins it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047166944', 'num_games_owned': 844, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1562541705}
review:
This game is one for the old school among us, beautiful artwork combined with typical turn based dungeon crawler with some new after battle twists, in short it is Etrian Odasey with extra bits.

The after battle twist is a risk reward system that can send you running back to base camp to heal up or continue on like normal. The reason is the reward chest that is trapped and how you open it can determine what you will be doing next, open it without a care and your party may end up all poisoned and if you forgot to pack antidotes or are too cheep then back to base if you can reach it that is.  Pay attention and you open the chest but you won't know what types of weapons nor can you use them until they are identified, that will depend on your INT factor as well as skills on your party.

Saving the game is done at the base, your main character upgrade is a choice that will determine your story faction.

But one thing that is missing is this game is a lesser version of the Playstation Vita copy which has more artwork as well as character classes.

The game does well enough on its own in that you will grind and make your way to the end, rush and you will die, make mistakes, fight bosses while under leveled and cry the game is too hard.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993895864', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1577501452}
review:
The positive reviews on this are frankly nonsense, this game is legit awful.

For a game that is so UI heavy, the UI is beyond terrible.  At one point I thought I had deleted a character with a button press, only to realize later that it was hidden behind some other obscure menu.  The UI/menus are scatterbrained and the game has you do tedious things in various nested menus again and again.

The game balance is dreadfully bad, the first zone has enemies that one shot your party members, which puts them out of commission for like an hour of real world time, forcing you to use other newly created members at level 1 with no items instead and if they die one to many times then its perma death.  The item store in town does not replenish items you need.. (like equipment for new members! and consumables for healing!) and you definitely need them because the game demands you grind your butt off in the first zone!  Literally I spent hours on the first quest and made what seemed to be zero progress, as it wanted me to 'hunt' a creature that was nowhere to be found, instead my heal items would get cursed after one use, and then my party members would get one shotted by regular mobs.  After about the 12th time of going back to town I decided I had had enough of this garbage.

It seems to me the only good thing about this game is the VO, and the music was alright, everything else was bad, to nonexistent, and by nonexistent I mean the graphics/art.  Battles are a joke both visually and mechanically.  There is no animation to speak of, its just 2d cards, and basic texture effects, most of the time you can't even tell what is going because it is so undeveloped visually.  Mechanically it was not fun, and extremely tedious, basically a simple AI could play this game because there was no real strategy, only grinding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129983784', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 293, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1577047655}
review:
《剑之街的异邦人》是一款由日本一出品的地宫类RPG，讲述玩家在飞机失事后莫名掉落至异世界，玩家成为天选之人，与队友一同猎杀“血统种”。游戏的欧式画风相当惊艳，可自定义的主角也大大增强了玩家的代入感，但前期难度大、练级枯燥等问题，还是容易让新人陷入一脸懵逼的状况，需要相当大的精力去摸索才能体会到其中乐趣。

可自定义的主角

或是为了增加玩家的代入感，或是为了给玩家提供游戏初始的更多选择，这款游戏在开局时支持玩家对角色进行自定义，虽然不支持捏人，但游戏的自定义内容也是多到炸。形象：玩家可从多达4页的立绘中选择自己喜欢的，这些立绘画风、气质等各不相同，传统日式画风、硬朗欧式画风，硬汉萌妹任君选择，同时也支持玩家自行导入喜欢的图片作为主角形象，值得一提的是玩家选择的立绘和性别并不挂钩，所以用着萝莉的形象操着硬汉的嗓音也并无不可。说到嗓音，根据玩家的性别提供一个基础音，玩家可通过调节三项数值来合成出自己想要的声线，这一点说是不多见。此外便是属性相关内容了，种族、年龄、职业、属性点等常规内容，虽然项目多，但一周目可进行选择的种类局限性却很大。总之，建立好属于自己的角色，异世界生活就此开始了。


惊艳到炸的音画

和传统的日厂游戏相去甚远，本作的画风罕见地采用了带有哥特色彩的欧式绘画风格，从角色到怪物，线条、用色都相当硬朗，威压感十足，在观看OP时，其中的大量宗教色彩更是令人沉迷其中。不过之前也有提及，玩家的角色、可招募的队友和部分敌人仍存在有标准的日式立绘，虽可以想象是给爱好萌豚画风的玩家多一个选择，但在这款游戏中还是略显违和。
另外游戏带来的听觉体验堪称一绝，BGM或幽静，或大气，各种场合多有相当贴切的音乐来做氛围营造，且风格也和画面一样偏向于欧式古典风格，别具一格。配音方面主要剧情都有配音，加上主角的自定义声线，代入感较高。

恶意满满的机制

作为一个新人，游戏之初的感受就是，好难！游戏开头便会有JK队友（大腿）加入，帮助我们清理敌人，前期基本就靠大腿带，然而和大腿形成鲜明对比的，是打人没伤害，挨打容易暴毙的玩家自身。也赖迷宫遇敌的设计，很容易刷出等级高出自己一大截的敌人，如果运气好活下来了，主角便能蹭到经验升升等级，运气不好就……白给在前期仿佛是一件非常自然的事情。
好吧好吧，为了提高自身水平，顺利攻关，练级是必须的，和众多DRPG相同，练级的过程漫长而枯燥，然而这款游戏还要更加神经病一些，等级接近的，经验少；等级差距大的，打不过，打不过就算了吧，他刷你脸上还没什么办法。
游戏中角色死亡消耗“生命点”，生命点耗尽就会删除角色。由于复活花销很大，且生命点回复成本高，有时甚至可以直接重新整个角色还快一点。这种恶意满满的设计，真实令人无比头痛。


暗藏玄机的地宫

作为游戏的核心系统——地宫中，本作还是有着相当不错的表现。游戏中的各个地宫风格迥异，全无重复感，且不同的不仅仅是外形，不同的地宫还有着不同的特殊机制：湖的水流造成移动障碍，影的单向通道让人处处提防；同时地宫之中也存在部分解密，取得某项道具或击败某个敌人方能进入下一场景。这些小机制也为整体枯燥的地宫旅途增添了些许的乐趣。

总结

音画质量相当出彩，外表一眼便惹人喜爱，但恶意满满的战斗和养成机制让游戏的中期很是憋气。对于DRPG和刷子游戏的受众，这款游戏应该较为适合，但对于一般路人玩家，投入大量时间去玩随时可能暴毙的刷刷刷也许不是个很好的选择。

以上测评为转载，原作者为

author: {'steamid': '76561198421035761', 'num_games_owned': 1807, 'num_reviews': 289, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1576740098}
review:
[h1]Stranger of Sword City剑之街的异邦人 [/h1]
本作是由Experience Inc.制作，NIS America, Inc.发行的一款地宫冒险类rpg游戏，讲述了主角因为空难天降异世界，而后莫名成为天选之人，“被迫”肩负起狩猎血统种的使命并开始冒险的故事。游戏采用传统的地宫探险模式，在游戏初始还提供了角色的自定义模式，独特的欧式风格也让游戏画面表现格外惹眼。此外，游戏的声音表现尚可，优质的bgm为游戏营造了不错的氛围，喜欢地宫冒险类游戏的玩家不妨一试。

[h1]👉短评👈[/h1]
在游戏刚开始的时候，游戏为玩家提供了一个内容十分丰富的自定义系统，玩家可以自主选择人物立绘、职业、属性加点等等内容，甚至还可以自定义主角的语音。作为一款地宫冒险类游戏，本作的探索系统以及战斗系统制作十分经典，并且还融合了“异乡人”这一特殊题材的独特元素，此外，玩家还可以通过游戏中的自动行走系统选中已探索的位置，之后小队就会自动行走，省去了一些复杂地图中繁琐的寻路过程。

在画面表现方面，游戏采取了独特的欧式画风，精致的人物立绘配合古典的背景给与玩家十分不错的视觉体验。玩家在不断的探索过程中还会遇到大大小小的怪物，同样的，怪物的立绘制作十分精致，cg中帅气的剑士vs巨魔的场景也是十分震撼，画面表现十分亮眼。在声音系统上，游戏为玩家提供了不错的bgm，多种人物配音虽然数量众多，但没有做到全程人物配音，游戏部分内容中的人物对话可能就只有干巴巴的文字了，但总体质量还不错，表现不俗。

总的来说，游戏哥特式的画风十分亮眼，音画表现质量极高，但在地宫探索方面却没有太多新颖的内容，刷怪练级的性质依旧十分突出，如果不太喜欢疯狂战斗练级的玩家购入前还需谨慎，推荐给喜欢地宫探索游戏的玩家。

[code]欢迎参观我的： [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33217084]真实评测[/url]
喜欢这篇评论，也麻烦点个赞，让更多人能够看到。[/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198026673593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 2449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1666153724}
review: It's more approachable and less inscrutable than some other games in this sub-genre, but Sword City won't let you forget it's still a dungeon crawler. Expect a lot of grind, a lot of traps, and a whoooole lot of party wipes on surprise attacks (and thus a lot of redundant backup characters). Class change is simple & fairly painless, but you're expected to focus a character's overall build rather than try to god-mode all the classes into one. the morale/divinity system opens up a number of super useful options for fights, but it's also tied into a weird faction system that's basically "choose your fantasy girlfriend." All in all, it's a fine entry to the field.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037888592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1490935687}
review: This game is hard. Permadeath is a thing, leveling and exploring is a chore. Those things don't make the ge bad, but I had a hard time enjoying it personally. I so desperately want to enjoy this title because I love the concept and customization available but I can't get far enough in to really like it. If you want a game with a challenge and like the jrpg aesthetic, give it a shot. But I personally can't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061178718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7321, 'last_played': 1656910392}
review:
If you are new to this game, PLEASE press f1 in game and read the manual. This is a very complex RPG with multiple mechanics that function somewhat differently than other RPGs. it takes time to learn how to play this game and even more time to master this game's mechanics. 

In my opinion, this is one of the most optimized RPGs ever. The fast apply makes grinding quick and fun! Fast apply allows you to input all your character attacks/commands and the game plays the turn out lightning quick. This cuts down on wasted time on trash mobs dying and other repetitive animations that you have to sit through in other RPGs. Grinding doesn't feel the slightest bit tedious because you want to ambush to get better loot and you can skip all animations to get right down to the numbers. This is a great experience for people who want to farm for stronger loot and utilize the ability to re-roll unique items (unique items can be found one time only and re-rolled for better stast) for better stats is awesome. This game also has some of the best character, and enemy portrait art/images I have ever seen in a video game. There were some enemies that were re-colors of other enemies, but this is used sparingly. The bosses in this game have the coolest portraits and that helps to immerse the player in the fantasy world of this game. You can even upload your own .png files to use as your character's portrait art! 

There are also multiple endings/story pathes, a New game+ (NG+) mode  and a difficult post game area that will keep you grinding to make your characters even stronger! 

In my opinion: This game has the best RPG quality of life mechanics ever! This game feels much better than Etrian Odyssey! (and I love the Etrian odyssey series...that WAS my favorite dungeon crawler till I played this game.)

Stranger of Sword City is the best turn-based dungeon crawler RPG I have ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094314206', 'num_games_owned': 1333, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 2346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1757, 'last_played': 1645414448}
review:
Nothing worse than a grindy game that only allows saving at distant intervals (only when you get back to base), that also crashes deep into outings.  It's really something in this kind of game to get some really good items, be on the way back, and then suddenly watch the window disappear along with a half hour of gameplay.

Thumbs down for bad save system + unstable game.

Side note to the devs: I know you're going for the retro feel of the old Wizardry games, the Western versions of which I played in my youth, and I really appreciate what you're shooting for here.  But even the Wizardry games moved on from that abominable save system in, what, Wizardry 5 or 6?  Bad save system = bad UI and player experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069180082', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1545075770}
review: i mean if you enjoy grinding for a weapon that actually does more then 10 (Base) damage, choose between 3 leaders to give some shit to (it really does not matter because you have to give them to some other person), getting lost in mazes, and finding bosses with cryptic summoning requirements, then sure, this is a good game for you, unless you cheat (which is confusing as fuck for this game engine, also yeah yeah cHeAtEr cHeAtEr!!!!), always have a good party with you, and you don't even have to find that perfect member, because you can make them yourself (i guess they just have someone with those SPECIFIC requirements hanging around.) Weird (and maybe unique system?) is the *Ambush* feature which is as it says, Ambush monsters and such for a chance to get a (really bad) chest with a (small) chance to get decent gear. thats really are there is with this, (also pirating this game fucks with the save system so dont do that, either buy it and play it or dont)

author: {'steamid': '76561198139763864', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1685208589}
review:
1. 발매한지 오래된 게임이라 그런지 썰렁한 인터페이스와 저해상도의 배경/브금을 가지고 있지만 조작 편의성 만큼은 던전 크롤러 게임들 중에서 좋은 편. (자동 이동과 전투시 반복 행동 기능이 있음)
2. 게임 난이도는 많이 어려운 편. 재미있게 어려운 게 아니라 짜증나게 어려움.
3. 스토리는 그닥임. 이세계에 떨어진 주인공이 원래 세계로 돌아가기 위해 싸우는 내용이라 해야하나? 선택받은 자라고 나오는데 딱히 플레이어가 주인공이라는 느낌이 안 듦. 그냥 떨거지 같음.

참고로 이 게임에 추천을 준 이유는 이것보다 재미 없는 던전 크롤러 게임이 너무 많아서 그럼. 하다보면 나름 할 만한 게임.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090417688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 29964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7855, 'last_played': 1621511089}
review:
プレイ過程

最初：数日間は一日20分程度でやったりやらなかったりで何が楽しいのだろう？と進める

中盤：戦闘が面白く、シナリオの世界観につかるほど中毒性が高い事に気付く
「この時点で気付きゲーム自体を回避できればよかった」

現在：一日の自由な時間をゲームに費やしているほどの廃人になってしまった。
「なんてものを知ってしまったんだ！あの時の自分に言いたい、止めとけと・・・」

結論：高評価の方々の説明通りです。
これからプレイしようと考えている方は重度の中毒性、廃人性があるのでほどほどに・・・。

author: {'steamid': '76561198130948719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 675, 'last_played': 1571276062}
review:
A mild thumbs-up for doing “Blobber” RPG mechanics well, though the overall game will not hold my interest to completion due to weak worldbuilding and narrative design.

The engine is stable and smooth. The art style isn’t exceptional, but gets the job done. The interface is easy to navigate and works very well with a controller (even better than mouse + keyboard, which I usually prefer). The base RPG mechanics will be familiar to those who played the old Wizardry series. Progression is steady with enough challenge to require strategic decision making, but without being so hard that it gets frustrating. There are mechanics available to recover from your failures; healing someone who has fallen in battle is time-consuming and expensive, but it can be done. It's also easy to replace fallen comrades with entirely new characters. The main character cannot die permanently, but if the entire party is wiped out, you must revert to a previous save.

The game mechanics are good, but the story is contrived, dry and thin, and there’s no good reason for it to be so 40 years after the first Wizardry game was released. You're a "Chosen One" / Stranger who has appeared in Sword City, a mashup of generic fantasy and steampunk, after a real-world plane crash. It seems like many victims of mass disasters appear here, as there is also a cruise ship one of the three game’s factions is using as a base. As someone from the real world, you're basically super-human. It's your job to hunt "LIneage Types" (bosses) to loot Blood Crystals that you use give to faction leaders to unlock meta powers like group healing over time. Your eventual goal is to get back to your world.

Sword City has Humans, a sort of Elf, Dwarves, cat people and a race whose name I forget but whose members looks like Link from the Zelda series. It has medieval tech from European and Japanese cultures, as well as Steampunk elements you only encounter during the meta-story; there are no guns or machines you can use while adventuring. And there's generic magic, mostly healing and elemental-type spells.

The monsters you fight are not logically cohesive; the first level (called a "labyrinth" in the game) is a desert space with ruined stone buildings and a stone dungeon underneath, in which you fight goblins that look like rats, hydras, flying insects, blobby type things, sprite-looking things with weird names like "Fitzgerald" (I forget the exact name, but there were three of them, three "Fitzgeralds"). And the occasional boss, I mean, “Lineage Type”. I assume this is a poor translation of something that makes sense in Japanese. Some of these “types” have mini-quest storylines attached to them, and some seem randomly placed so you have enough bosses to fight to collect the necessary blood crystals.

One of your gear slots is "Underwear". That deserves its own bullet point for weirdness. It's not done in a tawdry way; it's just one of a very small number of slots for armor that affects your stats. You have no foot slot, no hand slot, no leg slot, just armor, helmet and...underwear. And it's not a poor translation, as there are also references to "undies". They really decided to have a slot called "Underwear".

The limited NPC dialogue is anachronistic, excessively modern and full of slang, which distracts from any sense of place the rest of the environment might give. Major characters speak like teenagers; one even mentions "high school". In some dialogues, they completely break the 4th wall and refer to the "game" or to a specific mechanic or stat. The dialogue is also not skippable, and it goes on and on and ON, frequently using 30 lines of dialogue (each requiring a button press, visual-novel style) to express a concept that could have been done in 5.

I was entertained for a few hours while I was learning the mechanics, but the lack of any meaningful story means I’ll be quitting early and moving on to the next game. 50+ hours of grinding just to finish the game with no emotional payoff for success isn’t worth the time investment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057860137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 5963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5384, 'last_played': 1571226559}
review:
[b]# 前置き[/b]
2019年9月のフリープレイでちょっと手を出すつもりがそのまま購入。
この会社、チームムラマサのゲームは迷宮クロスブラッド、デモンゲイズをプレイ済み。
なので大まかな定石や難易度はわかっていたつもり。
というか、定石を知っていないと序盤で躓いて投げる可能性大。
1ヶ月ほどかけてストーリー～実績コンプまでやった感想です。

[b]# pros[/b]
[list]
    [*]思っていたよりストーリーが楽しめた、世界観など含めて上々の出来
    [*]クロスブラッドなどに比べると断然絵が良い、世界観にマッチ！
    [*]素直にトレハンが楽しい
    [*]主にボス戦でのギリギリの難易度も良かった、ちょいちょい死んで悔しい思いも多々
    [*]BGMもテンションを上げるものが多くマッチしていたと思う、が、所謂ボカロ系もあるので好みはわかれるかも
[/list]

[b]# cons[/b]
[list]
    [*]解像度など、画面サイズを変更させてほしかった、1280*720のウィンドウモードでしかプレイできなかった
    [*]ロマサガで言うところのLPが少なくて、雑魚戦での突然の死がよくある
        [*]LP少ないのは別に良いのだが、蘇生アイテムなどが少なすぎるのがストレス
        [*]突然の死からのLP消失してキャラ消失、からのゲームリセット案件、非常にストレスだった
    [*]トレハンは楽しかったが求める装備が出なくて終盤だれる
    [*]毒エリアはまだしも、スキル禁止や魔法禁止とかはちょっとしんどすぎる
    [*]序盤は所持金も少なく、キャラも弱い、敵は強い、なので難易度が高めに感じる
    [*]ナイトやウィザード等、職が少ない、編成の自由度が少ないように感じた
    [*]転職の回数が決まっていて気軽に転職できない、レベルも半分になる、気軽にできない・・・
[/list]

[b]# 総評[/b]
不満も多いけど個人的にはガッツリと楽しめた！ストーリーも良かったし、トレハンも楽しかったし。
ボス戦での試行錯誤はとても楽しくプレイ出来た。ストーリークリアからおまけ要素まではとてもバランスよく感じた。
最終的には大村正収集（とレベル上げ）に時間を費やすことに・・・そのあたりではバランスが悪くなって、まぁそこまでやるとダレると思う。

オススメするかは微妙なところだが、
チームラのゲームをプレイしたことがある、DRPG経験済み、で今DRPGやりたい気分！ならオススメできる！
普通のRPGを求める場合にはおすすめ出来ないかな。
ということでひとまずオススメ！に。※あとちょっと価格が高いので、セールの時にぜひ・・・

author: {'steamid': '76561198393895951', 'num_games_owned': 1507, 'num_reviews': 1228, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1569398667}
review:
[h1]游戏介绍及背景 	[/h1]
《Stranger of Sword City（剑之街的异邦人）》是一款由Experience Inc.制作，NIS America, Inc.发行的角色扮演类DRPG游戏。游戏讲述了您的航班在经过一个神秘入口时，却遭遇了坠毁的事故，醒来之后发现自己独自一人身处不明之境，游戏也就从此开始，我们应该怎样才可以生存下去呢？

[h1] 游戏的画面	[/h1]
游戏的画面虽然有点古老，但是人物的绘制还是依旧相当不错，这个从刚开始玩家选择自己的人物的时候就有着很不错的表现，而且可选的人物相当之多，什么法师剑士统统可以满足你的需求（关于他们的立绘我也感到游戏的立绘的制作的精细程度），然后就是自定义为自己的人物设定属性，这样的设计更是为游戏的开端带来了更多的变数，玩家的选择也变得更多，自由性也就变得越强。然后就是随着游戏的进行，游戏的CG你也将会慢慢的看到，质量也很不错，而且在路上会遇到各种各样的怪物，游戏也为他们绘制了不同的立绘，而且充满独特的魅力。

[h1] 游戏的玩法[/h1]
游戏的主要玩法主要是在迷宫之中探索的玩法，所以我们得有一定的方向感，但是这个不用担心，游戏左上角有地图给玩家进行之路，只要是探索过的地方，地图都会有所记录，然后当主角剧情达到一定的地步，就需要更多的队友来帮助你，所以快去组建属于自己的团队吧，然后就是战斗的模式，主要是以RPG回合制的形式进行展现，我们需要在适当的时间使用技能，然后穿插普通攻击，基本上还是可以打败她们的，但是这个我是通过刷级才感觉到舒服的，游戏的难度还是有点高的，如果前期没有刻意的刷级，其实被怪打死的情况还是可以发生的，而且我感觉概率很大，所以一定要有所准备在进行出击，最后就是我们还可以伏击怪物的运输队，这个可以说很有意思的，对方老大站在后面，难道你要逃跑？好吧，有时他还真的就跑了……

[h1] 游戏的优点	[/h1]
+很不错的人物创建模式
+刺激的RPG回合制战斗
+有着一定的剧情
+神秘的迷宫探索性

[h1] 游戏总结	[/h1]
总的来说，这款游戏还是相当不错的，而且质量上很是不错，如果你是一名DRPG游戏的爱好者，那么何不来尝试一下这款游戏的独有魅力。
评分：7/10

[code]欢迎参观我的： [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33626600]奸商评测[/url]
喜欢这篇评论，可顺手点个赞，让更多人方便看到。[/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198402061770', 'num_games_owned': 7055, 'num_reviews': 773, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1569150199}
review:
[quote]
[th]关注[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/39039781]斗鱼游戏社区[/url]，随时了解主播推荐的好游戏。[/th]
[tr][th]访问[b]斗鱼鱼吧社区[/b]参与互动，活动好礼送不停！[/th][/tr]
[/quote]

《Stranger of Sword City》译名剑之街的异邦人，是一款由日本一发行的欧美画风DRPG游戏。游戏共分为两部，PSV版为黑之宫殿， 而Xbox360和PC版则为白之王宫，两作在迷宫和敌人种类上会略有不同。不过首先要说的是本作不推荐给win10用户，PC版《剑之街的异邦人》会有严重的不定期闪退现象发生，并且打上汉化补丁游戏将随时卡死，无法进行。

[b] 穿越者们的街道	[/b]
[h1] 剧情	[/h1]
开篇过场动画的剧情非常老套，飞机失事，穿越到异世界。但在不远处，却有人在关注着从天而降的飞行物。
醒来后为主角引路的是一个奇怪的老人，带主角离开地底迷宫后老人却凶相毕露，召唤怪物准备吃掉主角，在他的口中念念叨着“神”“容器”一类让人听不懂的话。 
随后出现的是一名身着高中生校服的女剑士，从老人救下主角后，两人共同前往了剑之街。此时主角才知道，他并不是唯一的穿越者，整个剑之街中，到处都是和他一样经历的人。

[h1] 术语	[/h1]
异邦人：从其他世界穿越而来的人，异邦人在这个世界中具有讨伐魔物的实力。
剑之街：异邦人的聚集地，有一个完善公会体系。
血统种：体内蕴含血晶的魔物，如果不取走血晶血统种会不断自愈再生。
天选之人：异邦人中少数具备提取血晶能力的人，在主角来之前剑之街共有3人。
容器：每名天选之人都能获得神的庇护，会被赐予神气，而天选之人也是神气的容器。

[h1] 玩法	[/h1]
人物篇：
进入游戏前需要创建一名主角，而主角有两个要求，种族必须是人类，天赋必须是天选之人。到达剑之街后则再需要5人组建一个小队，小队成员不再有限制要求，但是天赋选择中没有天选之人。由于有了众多的种族选择，包括精灵、侏儒、矮人和猫人，因此年龄可以在10-99中随意浮动。种族将决定擅长的能力，而年龄决定复活和恢复所需要的时间。随后选择人物的天赋和职业，决定人物的特殊能力和武器。
探索篇：
在地图攻略中，人物天赋会有对应的作用。例如主角的天选之人，可以利用神气释放强力技能。而队友的天赋中，例如敏锐直觉这个天赋可以拆除地形中的陷阱。
随后是伏击系统，在屏幕右侧的显示的数字是士气值，通过消耗士气值可以在指定地点进行潜伏。潜伏过程中有概率会见到魔物的运输部队，随后可以观察敌人数据决定是否进行伏击。无论敌我，伏击方必定取得先手，但是敌方首领都会站在后排，并且随时准备逃走。如果伏击中被反杀，那将永远不会再次遇到这个运输队伍，如果逃走的话，以后还能有机会战斗。
战斗篇：
战斗中6人的阵型分为两排，无论敌我，在前排被全部消灭前后排不能成为单体攻击目标。人物分为攻击模式和防御模式，防御模式下不能进行攻击，但是其他操作不限制，因此一般不要让防御模式的成员在后排。战斗界面中，左边为前排右边为后排。
 
[h1] 体验	[/h1]
在游戏的风格上，《剑之街的异邦人》是一款偏黑暗风的游戏，题材也是格外小众的DRPG。不过如果能够避免闪退等一系列非游戏本身问题的话，本作的体验还是十分良好的。相对其他DRPG游戏，本作中有着许多十分人性化的功能，例如一键行走。打开大地图后，选择任意一个已探索的坐标，小队就会自动行走，对于DRPG这种需要时常赶路的游戏来说这个功能太有用了。
在创建人物时，有4页画风各异的人物形象供玩家选择，但是后来我发现在最后一页中还有空缺，后来我才知道，原来PC版《剑之街的异邦人》还为玩家提供了自定义人物形象的功能。而游戏所带的30种风格的人物配音，相信一定能让玩家制作出心仪的主角形象。
相对游戏的风格而言，剧情并不算沉重，穿越者的题材让故事拉近了玩家的距离。众多小系统免去了DRPG繁琐的限制，同时由于PC版的原因，键鼠让玩家有了更好的操作体验。

[h1] 结语	[/h1]
从游戏性上来看，《剑之街的异邦人》有着比一般DRPG更好的游戏体验，PC版还有着Xbox360和PSV都不具备的自定义功能。本作同样有着传统DRPG的多周目多结局以及刷刷刷元素，同时也加入了拆除陷阱、伏击敌人以及寻宝等独特玩法。日式的游戏玩法和欧美式的画风相结合，精美的立绘和过场CG搭配上应景的bgm，让玩家有了更好的感官体验。但是很可惜，由于游戏本身的原因，只有win10之前的用户可以体验这款游戏。

[quote]
加入[url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/GHYX]干货游戏[/url]&关注[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/35106417/]我的鉴赏家[/url]，不定期为大家带来诚意满满的游戏体验干货。
[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198011081947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1650001409}
review:
Okay.  Hey, you, person thinking about buying this or any other "Japanese Style" game.

Stop.

If you know what I mean by "Japanese Style" game and are still 100% thrilled about buying this game, go ahead you sick, masochistic bastard.  If you don't know what I mean then listen up.  I don't know if you know this but Japan is kind of...  weird.  When the Japanese make a game they have one of four concepts in mind:  Fighting Game, Rhythm Game, Racing Game, or Masochistic Sisyphean Oh-God-Why Grinding Game.

This game is the last type.

For the uninitiated, let me break down what that actually means in terms of game play.  Basically what it comes down to is, "Did you just donkey fuck that fight?"  What I mean to say is once you've managed to finish a fight, do you feel as though you just watched a poor, misguided girl (the enemies) get mounted and absolutely fucked by a donkey (your party)?  And I mean thoroughly ruined.  Like, you feel bad inside just a teeny bit now after the fact...  About a group of randomly generated monsters.  If your answer is anything less than a good donkey fucking, stop.  Do not proceed further.  You aren't strong enough.  Just around the next corner is a surprise boss fight that will absolutely destroy you.  Go back and grind again until said fight is 100% straight out of some back alley Tiajuana night club and a tinge of guilt is once again your favorite traveling buddy.  Go back to town, heal, stock up, buy some stuff and keep on grinding.  It doesn't matter if it's a boss fight, random fight, scripted whatever... If you so much as pause for one moment, you haven't grinded enough.

"That sounds tedius, Llama!  Who would ever make a game like that?  That doesn't sound like fun at all!" said the guy who has never seen a Nippon Ichi game.

Alright look, I'm not trying to say this game isn't good or you shouldn't buy it.  I just want you to understand that games like these take a certain amount of determination and perhaps a modicum of self-loathing if you want to get the most out of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970625493', 'num_games_owned': 1484, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 2243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2217, 'last_played': 1567472608}
review:
Some unfortunate design decisions keep this from being a good game. Not only does this game not respect your time, it is designed to waste it.

On the positive, I love the art style - the character and enemy designs are simply gorgeous, and the backgrounds are often very pretty as well. The premise is interesting, and I like the gameplay structure of exploring labyrinths, finding bosses, and defeating those bosses to progress and level up. The class system is very versatile, and the turn-based combat can be pretty fun.

On the downside, the game is punishing - not hard, just punishing. When a character gets knocked out in battle, they die and lose a life point. You can resurrect them back in town, but this takes about an hour of in-game dungeon exploring during which the character will be unavailable - when creating characters at the beginning, you better make a second copy of each character because you'll need it. Of course your secondary backup character will be lower level, but it's better than nothing. But when the character is finally resurrected, they'll still be down a life point, and characters only have 1-3 life points - when they lose their last life point, they're dead for good and cannot be brought back. You can recover a life point, but this takes about 4-7 hours of in game dungeon exploring, during which time that character is unavailable. So when a character gets knocked out, not only do you need to bring them back to town, but then you have to do without them for the next 5-7 hours of combat. If multiple characters get knocked out, you're then facing the choice of re-loading and losing however much progress you've made since then or spending 5-7 hours with a weak backup party grinding for loot and levels.

You'd figure that you could just play defensively and avoid character death, but the game doesn't work that way. The fight difficulty is like an EKG - flat lines followed by huge spikes. Standard enemy encounters will be trivially easy, with you beating several enemies without taking any damage. Then you encounter a boss, and the boss attacks 2-3 times a turn and can 2-shot any of your characters - if the boss hits the same character twice in one turn, they're dead. Later in the game enemies and bosses get one-hit-kills which will one-shot any character if the attack connects, and even party-wide auto-kill attacks.

Even among the standard enemy encounters, the game loves to occasionally throw enemies at you that are twice the level of everything else and will destroy you. A dungeon will be full of level 10-14 enemies that are trivial to defeat - the game features a "repeat last attack orders" button and a "fast forward to end of combat" button for a reason - but occasionally you'll encounter level 20 enemies. Sometimes these enemies look different, so that you'll notice, and other times they'll look exactly the same - the same exact Orcs that you've been killing without a second thought, except these will instead kill you. Better check the level of the enemy in each and every combat before you begin.

Unfortunately, levels sometimes mean nothing. As level 4-5 characters you will be killing level 10-14 enemies without taking a scratch. Then you'll come across a level 11 enemy in that same dungeon that has 10 times the armor and deals 10 times the damage of the other level 10 enemies. Only trial and error will tell you if this new level 11 enemy is as weak as all the other level 11 enemies or as strong as a boss and will 2-shot any of your characters or AoE the whole party for 1/3 of their health.

The class system is backwards, in that once you change out of a class you stop earning levels in that class, so a character you want to end up as a wizard should start as a cleric (or even a knight or dancer).

You'll want to min-max your characters from the very beginning, making your party 40 years old and your main character 60 years old for 3 and 6 extra stat points from the start (equivalent to 3-6 extra levels), and hitting the re-roll button over and over and over again to get 2-3 extra stat points. But even doing that, and putting points into Vitality for extra health, you characters will die to bosses, and you'll end up having to grind while they recover or grind to out-level and out-gear the content. And this was on the "Beginner" difficulty - I don't even want to know what "Normal" is like.

And the gear - your main way of increasing your strength - is random. It's random both in terms of what equipment you get - a ton of thrown weapons and magic wands when you want melee weapons, cloth armor when you want plate mail - and what quality - will that chest of swords contain broadswords or broken knives? And getting gear requires going into a dungeon, going to specific ambush sites, ambushing enemies to get loot, then leaving the dungeon and repeating. To get stronger, you have to grind for gear and hope to get lucky.

Etrian Odyssey handles these systems in a much better way. Knocked out characters have to be carried back to town leaving the party weak and vulnerable, but then you can revive them without having to waste hours grinding while they recover. When you multi-class, you can gain new skills in either class at each new level, without having to leave your original class behind. Enemies scale linearly without huge spikes - you know when you go to a new level that enemies will be harder, but they won't be impossibly hard. Every fight is challenging, you don't just auto-pilot your way through standard enemy encounters until you've progressed well beyond them. The bosses and mini-bosses are clearly marked so there's no surprise like one on-level enemy in a dungeon being 10 times stronger than all the others. And each new enemy you slay gives you materials to craft new equipment, taking the randomness out of character progression and getting new loot.

So unless you enjoy spending hours grinding for gear while your characters recover, pass on this game - as gorgeous as the character designs are - and play something else that isn't designed to waste your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263130906', 'num_games_owned': 1429, 'num_reviews': 1191, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1567430904}
review:
[h1]从零开始的异世界地宫生活[/h1]

《剑之街的异邦人》是一款由日本一出品的地宫类RPG，讲述玩家在飞机失事后莫名掉落至异世界，玩家成为天选之人，与队友一同猎杀“血统种”。游戏的欧式画风相当惊艳，可自定义的主角也大大增强了玩家的代入感，但前期难度大、练级枯燥等问题，还是容易让新人陷入一脸懵逼的状况，需要相当大的精力去摸索才能体会到其中乐趣。

[h1]可自定义的主角[/h1]

或是为了增加玩家的代入感，或是为了给玩家提供游戏初始的更多选择，这款游戏在开局时支持玩家对角色进行自定义，虽然不支持捏人，但游戏的自定义内容也是多到炸。形象：玩家可从多达4页的立绘中选择自己喜欢的，这些立绘画风、气质等各不相同，传统日式画风、硬朗欧式画风，硬汉萌妹任君选择，同时也支持玩家自行导入喜欢的图片作为主角形象，值得一提的是玩家选择的立绘和性别并不挂钩，所以用着萝莉的形象操着硬汉的嗓音也并无不可。说到嗓音，根据玩家的性别提供一个基础音，玩家可通过调节三项数值来合成出自己想要的声线，这一点说是不多见。此外便是属性相关内容了，种族、年龄、职业、属性点等常规内容，虽然项目多，但一周目可进行选择的种类局限性却很大。总之，建立好属于自己的角色，异世界生活就此开始了。
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1852244376

[h1]惊艳到炸的音画[/h1]

和传统的日厂游戏相去甚远，本作的画风罕见地采用了带有哥特色彩的欧式绘画风格，从角色到怪物，线条、用色都相当硬朗，威压感十足，在观看OP时，其中的大量宗教色彩更是令人沉迷其中。不过之前也有提及，玩家的角色、可招募的队友和部分敌人仍存在有标准的日式立绘，虽可以想象是给爱好萌豚画风的玩家多一个选择，但在这款游戏中还是略显违和。
另外游戏带来的听觉体验堪称一绝，BGM或幽静，或大气，各种场合多有相当贴切的音乐来做氛围营造，且风格也和画面一样偏向于欧式古典风格，别具一格。配音方面主要剧情都有配音，加上主角的自定义声线，代入感较高。
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1852244421

[h1]恶意满满的机制[/h1]

作为一个新人，游戏之初的感受就是，好难！游戏开头便会有JK队友（大腿）加入，帮助我们清理敌人，前期基本就靠大腿带，然而和大腿形成鲜明对比的，是打人没伤害，挨打容易暴毙的玩家自身。也赖迷宫遇敌的设计，很容易刷出等级高出自己一大截的敌人，如果运气好活下来了，主角便能蹭到经验升升等级，运气不好就……白给在前期仿佛是一件非常自然的事情。
好吧好吧，为了提高自身水平，顺利攻关，练级是必须的，和众多DRPG相同，练级的过程漫长而枯燥，然而这款游戏还要更加神经病一些，等级接近的，经验少；等级差距大的，打不过，打不过就算了吧，他刷你脸上还没什么办法。
游戏中角色死亡消耗“生命点”，生命点耗尽就会删除角色。由于复活花销很大，且生命点回复成本高，有时甚至可以直接重新整个角色还快一点。这种恶意满满的设计，真实令人无比头痛。
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1852244467

[h1]暗藏玄机的地宫[/h1]

作为游戏的核心系统——地宫中，本作还是有着相当不错的表现。游戏中的各个地宫风格迥异，全无重复感，且不同的不仅仅是外形，不同的地宫还有着不同的特殊机制：湖的水流造成移动障碍，影的单向通道让人处处提防；同时地宫之中也存在部分解密，取得某项道具或击败某个敌人方能进入下一场景。这些小机制也为整体枯燥的地宫旅途增添了些许的乐趣。

[h1]总结[/h1]

音画质量相当出彩，外表一眼便惹人喜爱，但恶意满满的战斗和养成机制让游戏的中期很是憋气。对于DRPG和刷子游戏的受众，这款游戏应该较为适合，但对于一般路人玩家，投入大量时间去玩随时可能暴毙的刷刷刷也许不是个很好的选择。

以上测评仅供参考，只代表个人意见

author: {'steamid': '76561198262952897', 'num_games_owned': 3879, 'num_reviews': 822, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1567843211}
review:
[h1]前言[/h1]
《Stranger of Sword City剑之街的异邦人》是一款暗黑幻想风格的迷宫探索JRPG，steam版为“白之王宫”版，“黑之宫殿”仍然是主机端。美术风格偏向欧美风，大量精致的立绘和自由定制的主角与队友令人愉快。游戏音乐也是哥特风格。不过本作的复活机制和战斗难度比较“致命”，团灭删号是常有的事；练级难度也很高，几个小时都不一定能升个几级，必须向前辈学习攻略方法才能比较好地体验游戏。适合电波对上的玩家。此外游戏无官中。

[h1]剧情[/h1]
[quote] “一望无尽的极夜星空下，蝴蝶飞舞的‘剑之街’，异种族的住人，数不尽的迷宫，以及令人恐怖的魔物。你作为突然坠入这个世界的异邦人，为了回到原来的世界，也为了活下去，不得不选择战斗的道路。”[/quote]
飞机失事穿越，在异世界等候着的老头居然是反派！关键时刻斩杀怪物救下主角的强大同伴居然也是穿越者！这里到处都是穿越者！身为“异邦人” 中唯三的“天选之人”之一，你将肩负起狩猎唯有天选之人才能杀死的“血统种”的使命。

[h1]游戏体验●Bad[/h1]
游戏有蒹葭补丁，但是打上之后就无法解锁成就。使用中文输入法会直接报错。第一次运行疯狂卡顿，勉强看到返回异邦人区就跳出；不过以上问题之后就再也没有出现，运行十分流畅，原因不明。

游戏开局总是躺尸，全靠御姐队友救活。如果没躺就可以升上一级。（据说二周目就是御姐躺尸了，怪物强度似乎还会随周目、遭遇次数增加。）玩家只能在剑之街异邦人街区的基地存档，出门探索迷宫时完全不能存档。在迷宫中经常会遭遇高出十多级的强大怪物（我第一次探索就直接碰到十几级的骷髅怪，打又打不中，砍过来直接秒杀，反击只有火球术能造成两位数伤害，其他武器全被闪避。过几个回合还会召唤援军，骷髅怪1变4,4变7，只能被打死），此时发动“神力”逃跑需要的“士气”刚好耗尽，就会直接迎来团灭Game Over。

在迷宫中探索获得的武器只能离开迷宫的时候鉴定出属性，没有离开前是无法使用的。

游戏的引导也并不完善，说明中全都是数字，必须自己打开帮助页面查看键位（然而连打开帮助的指引也是数字，只能自己试）第一个隐蔽点的任务也没有提示，居然要走封闭区域隐蔽。回城再回来士气也完全没有回复，大概是因为没有在隐蔽点消耗的士气不会回复吧。（绝望ing）

游戏中角色死亡除了主角都会降低所谓的“生命点”，每死亡一次就会扣除，生命点耗尽就会删除角色。死亡后复活的花费很高，复活后还必须丢在基地消耗大量时间回复生命点。（有的前辈直言不如删角色重建）

角色打等级相近的怪获得的经验极少，越级又打不过，练级十分费肝。

[h1]游戏体验●Good[/h1]
游戏的战斗可以“快速行动”来直接跳过冗长的行动说明。

玩家自己和队友都可以自定义，头像除了内置的精美立绘似乎还支持导入；性别、声音、年龄、头像各自独立，你完全可以选一个男生女相的99岁美少女，发出的声音却洪亮阳刚。游戏职业和加点需要根据种族特点来加，不然会影响队伍战力。

游戏哥特式画面和CG很不错，还有同样哥特式的音乐营造氛围。游戏的OP十分惊艳。

主要剧情都有配音。（不过一般的对话配音就不完整了）

[h1]结语[/h1]
本作美术充满魅力，但是游戏难度劝退，没有耐心和毅力连10级也别想升到。游戏目标玩家范围比较窄，建议被画风吸引的玩家慎重考虑。

[code]欢迎参观我的： [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/7421824]双鱼星✪ω✪皇家飛机场[/url]
如果你喜欢这篇评论，也麻烦点个赞，让更多人能够看到。[/code]

review: Лично я нахожу игру скучной и невообразимой по многим направлениям, но в основном это то, как выглядит мир и насколько проста и скучна битва.По сути, это просто тестовая игра, созданная новыми разработчиками, которую Япония любит делать иногда, потому что люди все равно будут их покупать.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045381877', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 2587, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1567151771}
review: Stranger of Sword City seems like a decent dungeon crawl. The game feels retro but in a good way. Overall I dont have a lot to say about this one, but if you think you may be down for a 2D dungeon crawl Stranger of Sword City seems like a it has a decent chance of being what you are looking for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006879453', 'num_games_owned': 1721, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 6687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6686, 'last_played': 1568901271}
review:
[h1] Stranger of Sword City - A Return to Hard Core Dungeon Crawling[/h1]

[b]Stranger of Sword City has quickly become one of my favourite dungeon crawlers of all time thanks to its gorgeous art, turn-based JRPG battles and a large variety of customization with lots of different classes and the ability to class change and mix-and-match.[/b]

Make no mistake, Stranger of Sword City is not without its faults. But to me the many great points the game has far outweight the bad. Lets quickly go over some of the major points that may cause heart ache for some, and the points that made me keep playing the game until the very, very, very end despite its faults.

[list]
 [*] The game is very unforgiving, to a ridiculous extent.
 [*] There is a big focus on loot, tons of ways to equip your cast.
 [*] Ambushing enemies rewards you with unique and powerful weapons and armor.
 [*] Grinding is necessary for later dungeons, especially post-game.
 [*] The story is interesting and doesn't pull any punches.
 [*] Multiple endings depending on your choices and Divinity-tree.
[/list]

Stranger of Sword City is a tough game, it doesn't hold your hand and is not afraid to punish you if you make a bad decision. There is perma-death, even on the easiest difficulty level so careful thinking and caution are essential for survival.

Your characters will have a set number of hearts depending on what age you assign them in the character creation. The older the character, the more skillpoints you get to assign, but in return your hearts will be lower. Each time your character falls on the battlefield they will lose a heart. Run out of hearts, and you lose that character forever. The only exception is your player-character who will always stick with you no matter what, and as such I recommend you put them in the front-line as either a tank or a damage dealer.

You can revive characters from death, and replenish their hearts at the guild headquarters. However this process takes lots of time, or tons of cash if you use the instant recovery and is not to be recommended. There are also a few items that can restore hearts, but they are extremely rare and difficult to acquire. All in all, I recommend you save often and play very cautiously. Also I do not recommend creating a character with less than two hearts, since a single death will wipe that character from existence, and there are a few insta-kill moves that bosses and end-game enemies like throwing out.

Luckily, not everything is quite so grim and you do have the power of the goddesses to aid you in these tough times.

As you progress through the game and acquire more and more Blood Crystals from bosses, you can hand these in to any of the three deities and they will reward you with powerful abilities. The Divinity skill tree lets you pick abilities that will best suit your needs. Divinities are very powerful special moves that do not take up a turn to use (with the exception of Charge attacks), and can be used at the start of each turn in addition to your normal skills. Divinity moves cost Morale to perform, which can be gained from fighting enemies normally. Who you choose to give crystals to affects the overall story too, and as such the ending, so think carefully before you make your offerings.

Finally, the art direction deserves a mention as my favourite thing about this entire game.

The character portraits and enemies are absolutely beautifully drawn, and the game lets you pick any character portrait you want without any bearing on your class, so feel free to look through the huge assortment of artstyles and character designs and pick your favourites. The bosses is where the artist shows off their true skill though. The foul beasts you encounter are not just intimidating, but captivating and memorable at the same time. The overall asthetic is dark, unsetteling, almost H.P. Lovecraftian in a way, and it fits the game's hardcore approach to dungeon crawling perfectly.



In conclusion, Stranger of Sword City is a game dear to my heart and I strongly recommend it to those who enjoy a difficult game where caution is a necessity and you need to take your time and think your options through carefully.

Strategy is a must, and you should not be afraid to experiment and try out new things when you run into problems. Often times a seemingly impossible boss battle can be beaten at your level, but you have to try a different approach. However since your characters level up and powerful loot can be gained from ambush battles, you can usually grind your way to greatness and simply power-through difficult encounters. Drop rates are low and leveling takes a long time later on, so I think the game does not recommend this idea, and rather expects you to try different classes and strategies instead, but near the end of the game some battles are so difficult that grinding loot is less of a choice and more of a requirement.

This balance between strategic choice and simple stat-checks is not an easy one to strike, and Stranger of Sword City does struggle with it a bit. But all in all I think it does a very good job at everything it sets out to do, and it has quickly become one of my favourites.



[b]TLDR:[/b] [strike] The Dark Souls of Dungeon Crawlers[/strike]

author: {'steamid': '76561198257696182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 3881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3881, 'last_played': 1566934748}
review:
Text or Action
☐ Visual novel
☐ Don't be in a TL:DR mood while playing
☐ Cutscenes are frequent, long and occasionally annoying
☑ Strikes a good balance between plot and gameplay
☐ Plot is mostly an excuse to fight
☐ Straight to the action

SoSC contains a lot more plot than most blobbers, and it's actually pretty decent.  There are some relevant choices to be made as well, which affect the ending.

Difficulty
☐ Final Fight 3
☐ Typically on mental cruise control with occasional stop and consider moments
☐ Planning ahead a bit is encouraged to do well
☑ Grind hard or lose harder
☐ Saga Frontier

It's modeled after Wizardry, so expect to grind.  Grind intelligently (ambush in the correct areas), otherwise be frustrated.  The game uses a lot of modern conveniences (easy access map, auto move and quick combat) to speed things along.

System issues
☐ This shit should never have left beta
☐ I performed the controller/keyboard toss over data loss
☐ Crashed occasionally but nothing too major
☐ Odd buggy quest here and there
☑ All looked great

Storyline
☐ Old gold box games have more story
☐ Confusing or utterly ridiculous, possibly poorly translated
☐ Fit for grade school kids
☐ Lighthearted yet interesting 
☑ Adult and/or dark in nature, captivating
☐ Gripping, hard-to-predict plot twists

Immersion
☐ Thinking about playing online poker instead
☐ Not terrible, but a poor design mechanic is interfering with my enjoyment
☐ I thought about plot or my next move while away
☑ Just ONE more turn
☐ I'll sleep when I'm dead

I'd been looking for a Wizardry-clone-type game that's similar to Wizardry - Tales of the Forsaken Land (PS2) and this comes pretty darn close.  SoSC is similar to Etrian Odyssey as well.  Class and skill system made me feel like my time spent grinding made a huge difference.  I love the atmosphere.  The dungeons are all beautiful, and I especially liked the haunted town.  SoSC is definitely one of the better party blobbers out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021895842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1566822385}
review:
Very good dip back into a very old style CRPG not seen much these days. Reminds me of the original Bard's Tale and Wizardry games, except we get an in-game map that saves on graph paper abuse. The game play is trickier than it looks on the surface. Party roles, placement, and making use of the ambush system are important keys. Pay attention to the levels of enemies and beware of gear with weakness on it. Having a character in full level encounter one of the low level magic users who can cast fire magic is a great way to lose a life point.

Having to recover injured characters with a partial party or rotating membership can be a bit painful, but you can compensate for it quite a bit just by choosing two weak maps and alternating between them to respawn the fixed encounters. Also realizing that the shop sold gear is mostly not worth purchasing, so you're best saving up your money for consumables, especially things that rez a fallen party member. If you are someone with super limited playtime you may dislike the game just due to the required grind at each new map to gear up before progressing the storyline, but if it's a game style you miss from your youth, you will find a lot of fun to be had here. The ability to class change and stack new abilities into the same character is a lot of fun too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056338059', 'num_games_owned': 2421, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1129, 'last_played': 1593234320}
review:
この会社のゲームはシステムを理解していないとすぐ死ぬので、序盤でつまずく場合は、

・ステ振りは15くらいまでは全キャラVIT優先（HPを確保）
・敵のレベルを確認する癖をつける（レベル差が大きい場合は閃光退却）
・強い敵とは戦わない（呪文や全体攻撃を使ってくる厄介なのは閃光退却）
・神気スキルは出し惜しみしない（士気は戦闘中に回復するので雑魚戦でも積極的に使う）
・バフ、デバフを重ね掛けする（ヒット、アボイド系を使うのが前提のバランス）
・対精霊、対不死のマジックウェポン、ホーリーウェポンを忘れない（スライムは精霊）
・タンク役はレベル10になったら防御スキル連打（ナイトは鉄壁の守り、ニンジャは分身。序盤はナイトが安定）

上記あたりを心がければ、雑魚戦で心が折れることは減るはずです（折れないとは言っていない）

そして転職は積極的に行いましょう。
レベル、HP、MPが半分になるデメリットがありますが、他職業のキーになるスキルや、装備を使用できるようになるメリットの方が大きいです。
例えばサムライ→ニンジャだと、二刀流で全体致命攻撃をばらまくアタッカーになります。
スキル枠を増やせるレベル13（スキルトークン）が転職機会の目安ですが、重要スキルは低レベル帯にもそろっているので、必要なものをつまみ食いするだけでもそれなりに有用です。まあ一周あたりの転職回数に制限があるので、ある程度の計画性は必要ですが……。

※新釈のsteam版発売が決定。めでたい。
