author: {'steamid': '76561198143712190', 'num_games_owned': 634, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 852, 'last_played': 1693401675}
review:
The game could use better explanation of certain things such as what stats, skills, attributes/enchantments, etc. exactly do, because some of them are either vague or downright not explained at all. In addition to that, money's pretty useless outside class changing. Most, if not all of your gears and items will come from ambush points because Gillius is a pretty lazy shopkeeper and doesn't restock nor add in new items and gears to his shop. I think it also costs money to revive(?) party members who still have lifepoints left, but I didn't bother with that because I opted for the increased starting stats in exchange for only having one lifepoint for all party members since I'd rather be careful and avoid them dying in the first place, or just reloading if they do die of instead losing out on those additional early stat points. 
Story's pretty alright, got that SMT vibes to it, with the 3 alignments and all that. 
Graphics/art is alright too, but pretty inconsistent. Choosing the portrait for your MC and party members and you already see the different artstyles, which is pretty jarring. I mean it's great that you have choices, but at least make them blend to the game. Soundtrack does its job, I've already associated certain music to certain things/areas/situations, which is what the soundtrack's supposed to do, but it's nothing phenomenal.
Gameplay's great, I like dungeon crawlers and planning out your party members' class, stat growths and all that. Class system has great potential too if you like to grind for it, but I've seen others say that sticking to just one class for all your characters for the rest of the game will still suffice, but I personally made full use of the class change system since I like making overpowered characters.
Overall, it's a pretty nice game which could've used a lot more polishing here and there, but given this game's already a few years old, I doubt they'll make significant updates to the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071865002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1561879307}

author: {'steamid': '76561198272690093', 'num_games_owned': 961, 'num_reviews': 326, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1562258082}
review:
＜このレビューはファーストインプレッションです。クリア後に追記・修正される可能性があります。＞

グラフィックとBGMが良いダンジョンRPG。

難易度は公式が明言するほどの高難易度であり、難易度ノーマルですらチュートリアルダンジョン（鉄の廟の血統種撃破）突破に2時間かかるほど。

────────────────────────────────────────────


唐突にレベルが倍近い雑魚が出てくるため、いつもの調子で殴っていると味方が死んでいることが多い。
出現場所もほぼ全域であり、攻撃する前に確認したほうが良いだろう。


作中でのシステム説明は簡素なものだが、実はヘルプにかなり充実した解説がある。

種族や才能の説明に操作方法も載っているだけでなく、本作では呪いの仕様が他ゲームと違ったりするため、
始まったらF1を押して熟読することをおすすめする。

────────────────────────────────────────────

難易度は高いというものの、その大半がレベルが倍近い雑魚が出てくることのようで、実際にカーソルを合わせないとレベルが倍近くあるかわからない。
強敵でも何でもない雑魚のため、せめて常時レベル表記か特殊な表記でわかりやすくしてほしかった。


もう半分の理由は難易度ノーマルですらかなり難しいことであり、序盤ですら装備集めのための周回中でうっかりすると味方が死ぬ（そもそも難易度の違いが明記されていない問題も）。

この手のゲームの熟練者以外は難易度ビギナーのほうが良いだろう。

一応難易度変更のアイテムも販売しているため、うっかり間違えても途中で変更は可能。

────────────────────────────────────────────

ロマサガのようにHPとは別のLPというシステムもあり、これがゼロになると問答無用で消滅する。

死亡からの復活もLPの回復も「敵との戦闘回数（強敵ほど良い）」に応じて回復し、序盤で死ぬと復活させるのに延々と何時間も戦闘し続ける羽目になるため、誰かが死ぬとリセットが楽だろう。

どうやら10人近くのメンバーをぐるぐる回しながらプレイすると良いらしい。

また[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=699762987]画像インポート[/url]も可能であり、好きなキャラで冒険できるのも良かった。


他に一部環境だとフリーズしやすいようだが、どうやら[url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/409890/discussions/2/357288572136203340/]特定のプロセスが悪さをしている[/url]との情報もあるため、プロセスキルを試されてみても良いかもしれない。

それでも直らない場合、以下の方法を取ると解決するかもしれない。

・IMEをMSIME→GoogleIMEにする
・セキュリティソフトの除外リストに入れる
・Superfetchを無効にする
・Touch Keyboard and Handwriting Panel Serviceを無効にする
・Tablet PC Input Serviceを無効にする
・板タブのUSBを抜く（特にBAMBOO系）

────────────────────────────────────────────

現時点での評価は可もなく不可もなくだろうか。

突然出てくる倍近いレベルの雑魚や、特に世界観として説明のなかったLPなどシステムとして必要なのかと疑い深い要素もちらほら。

最序盤でチュートリアルダンジョン突破に時間がかかったのもレベルが足りなかったからが9割であり、最初の5人（と主人公）は初期レベル3にしておいたほうが、サクサク進んで良かったかもしれない。

author: {'steamid': '76561198027928203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1565578253}
review:
It's a fun game, recommended if you like dungeon crawling and turn based rpg games.
A few tips to enjoy it more: Make a lot of characters as early as possible, because they can die often and they also take a lot of time to heal back to normal once they die.
Ambush a lot and early to get powerful armor and weapons that you cannot buy.
Seek the special monsters (lineage types) because they give special abilities that help a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011093795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 7876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7304, 'last_played': 1707781894}
review:
J'ai acheté ce jeux il y a longtemps...

Je l'ai essayé, je l'ai détesté...

Non pas pour sa qualité graphique déplorable mais  pour sa difficulté.

Généralement, la difficulté me force à me penché sur le jeux et a donné le meilleur de moi même. 
Ici,  vu que c'est un jeux de rôle tour par tour. La difficulté est dans votre farm de niveaux; Si vous êtes un farmeur, vous pouvez jouer en normal sinon....


Comme moi un an plus tard, je m'y suis remis. J'ai commencé en facile. Et je l'ai terminé.  Super conclusion hein !!

Je n'avais pas compris à l'époque. Pas le bon moment peut être? Mais ce jeux est une tuerie pour tout ceux qui veulent/voulaient personnalisé leur héros. Et quand je dis personnaliser leur héros, je parle bien de leurs stats et compétences !
Ce jeu permet de passer par plusieurs classes (guerrier, mage, prêtre, voleur, danseur ) et d'apprendre leur compétences sur un seul personnage ! A la fin il s'agit de choix de quels comp je met.

J'ai adoré les 121.7 hures de jeux que j'ai mis dedans (- les 10 heures du premier essai). 

Ma conclusion :  Ce jeux est moche mais ce jeux est bon ! Punaise si vous aimez le bon gameplay qui vous donne envie de continuer votre personnalisation de personnages, ce jeu est fait pour vous ! Si vous êtes quelqu'un qui aime la facilité parce que vous n'aimez pas buter contre quelque chose qui pourrait vous faire avancer dans votre progression de joueur, et bien passé votre chemin. Vous raterez beaucoup mais bon tout le monde n'est pas parfait.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053713663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 8422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8422, 'last_played': 1556561309}
review:
Stranger of Sword City is the first game in a specific genre that is unlike any other I have played before. Hardcore dungeon crawler, something I had no idea of before I first opened this game and dived in. After finally completing this adventure in it's entirety I can say so many things about it, both good and bad. 

Ultimately I think that this game lives to what it promises, and to what it wants to deliver as a game. It wants you to suffer, it wants you to feel proud when you prevail, and it wants to keep you on the edge of your seat wondering if you'll make it through the fight alive. Even if you do make it, who did you have to sacrifice along the way? Will you and all your friends make it home? What twist will the story and the game throw at you next?

Hardcore in every sense, unfriendly and missing the hand holding that many players would expect, you're completely on your own as you learn to navigate the treacherous land of Escario. While I can appreciate this, and know it's exactly the type of niche that this genre of game hits and expects you to adapt to, this game's difficulty for my taste is a bit of a skew from what i'd prefer in a game. The difficulty isn't in learning a pattern, or figuring out how to do what in the fight ahead of you. Well, that's not completely true but it's not completely wrong. 

Even if you play your best and excellently navigate the battle, much of the flow lies purely in numbers. Sometimes I fought a boss and completely stomped it within a few turns, the second time I fought that boss he destroyed half of my party in one turn. This game has such turbulent RNG that even the 99% chance to hit misses from Xcom would laugh at how silly it is. This type of pure chaos can be extremely funny, or extremely insufferable. Whatever you feel of it, it is the name of the game. Your only other ally than luck is well, influencing that luck, and by that I mean grinding your butt off and boosting your stats until you come back and own it. Or try to own it, before the dragon god attacks 27 times and does somewhere in the 10k+ range of damage to your team. Then the only thing you'll be owning is that reload button as you load up attempt number 7.

Gameplay is extremely hit or miss, and even as I say that I myself am highly conflicted on my total thoughts. I think personally I would love this game a lot more if it didn't have the extremely high difficulty (aka randomness and expectation that you know what you've gotten into so deal with it) and was a simpler, easier RPG that didn't require hours and hours of grinding loot and levels to overcome. That being said though, it is a part of the game that I grew with, and while I can't say I love the stuff i'm scoffing at, it would undeniably not be the same game without it. So... yeah. 

Outside of the gameplay I love this game. I love the theme, the music, the characters, all of it. The story starts out like any japanese rpg, fun and fluffy and inspiring. But this game is not a happy go lucky tale. It is dark, and as you proceed through your typical rpg adventure you learn the world around you isn't as simple a life as it seems. There are many moments of wonder, of sadness, of all sorts of feelings. Times I laughed or grinned and times I felt genuinely affected in a negative way by what I had experienced. Sometimes the adventure was weird or the connecting of the dots was strange, but for the most part, it's a roller coaster of a story that will take you on a roller coaster of emotions. 

Whether or not you choose to take up the mantle of the chosen one yourself, I have poured my heart into this blood crystal gem of a game, and as I lay it gently on the wall of conquests I've finished, I float off like a butterfly to wherever gaming takes me next. 

Farewell Sword City, I won't forget you anytime soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998775097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 6292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6292, 'last_played': 1555485477}
review:
Strangers of Sword City is a LONG JRPG Dungeon Crawler Wizardry / Might & Magic type of game.  While not AS hardcore as these titles, it is hardcore enough.  It has a decent good storyline and solid game play mechantics.  Be warned though at least 30-50 hours of this game you'll be grinding in the same spot(s) for awhile.

Perhaps the most hardcore part about this game is: death.  Death is unforgiveable, like Dark Souls.  Aside from the main character, if a character gets killed they lose a life point.  Should they lose all their life points, that character "vanishes" as so the lore states, which makes sense.

You have the option to revive them which takes time - time passes based on battles difficutly.  This alone takes a good 20-25 battles.  But then if you want to recover their life point, you have to hoptilzied them.  This can take an additional 30-50 battles!  While there are limited items that can recover them instantly, it's rare to get them.  You can also just pay gold, but that increases base on the characters level and gold doesn't drop as much.  So if you get whacked, sometimes it's best to start over.  That's what I did, at best lost 20 minutes of progress.  Death does NOT kid around!  It's safe to say, make backup characters as they level on the side as you do.  Leveling up doesn't take TOO long but it is a grind.

The battles and combat are tough, and sometimes the enemies RNG of what level you encounter can be brutafully high.  It's best to just run away at that point.  The game is pretty good about that since your first power is instant run away (other than boss battles).

Pros:  Old School Baldars Gate portraits are a nice touch for characters.
Dungeon Crawler feels with a good map system and fast travel to any location on a dungeon once you find it.
Long advetnure and challegning dungeons that keep you going.

Cons:  Death does not kid around
Can be a grind, be aware.
Special boss battles tend to show up too often in random battles atofore you have a chance to beat the regular enemies. I found this to annoying.  Lucikly, easy to run away from these special fights.
Not as many classes as I'd hope but enough to keep the game flow going.
Limited shop nearly everything you find will be on the field battle.

6/10 Overall enjoyed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047435696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2540, 'last_played': 1552145779}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198047160036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 17603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10465, 'last_played': 1701797245}
review:
It was my first Dungeon Crawler and if I am asked if I feel remorse for buying it the answer is a clearly :NO. I love and hate this game at the same time. 

+ Story: I just love it. It starts mysertious and keeps this feeling/vibe up till the end.

+ Characters: I love them and it broke my heart a few times trough the story. But you can understand why they act most of the time while you play trough the story.

+ Music I love the music. It fits the battles, overworld and the base.

+ Graphic/Design Just gorgeous. The game is just beautiful. I love the style of the Characters, base and the world. The Monsters look really diffrent than every other game I have played before. Nothing is the same and the style reminded me of "Dark Tormentum" (great game try it)

+ Walking in the overworld: I am one oft those people that really enjoy walking and exploring the map with a feel of danger and I like some special things in each map. (teleportation wrong way suddenly poison gas, you cant use skills/spells great imrpvoement in difficulty)

+ Spells/Skills Classes. I love the diffrent type of spells/skills & of course the classes. You can battle in your own style and you have a front and backline. You can Attack, Defend, use items, Spells & skills and of course Divinity's

+ Divinitys: I Love this concept. Depending on your choices you will get diffrent Divinitys witch willl decide your fate in battle. And keeps it firrent everytime. Without the right one you will havea hard time (choose carefully but you will get most of them)

+ NG +: You can play with your same characters in a new game. Play the same game again but with a waaaay harder difficulty. Dont overestimate yourself. Even when you are highleveld you can be killed easy.

+ Ambushing: I love this feature, Some bosses can only be found with this feautre and the best way to collect equipment. You got 5 possible enemies to choose from. You dont like the first one? Just use pass. Is the last to dangerous? Leave them alone.(except for bosses! Be careful)

+ Storage: Great function that is located in the base. It is a combination with the shop wher you can sell/store equipment you dont need. It also shows you while takign the equipment out which character can use which.

+/- Character creation: Both positive and negative for me. You can choose your class and lookout (doesnt affect your stats) and hearts and one mastery. (Not get ambushed a lot, easy treasure opening for example) Sadly it also is a critic point. Skill points gain is random. Getting a 10 takes a looong time and you will need every point in the NG+ games. Not the best but also not the worst system.

+/- Difficulty: I mentioned above the lvl problem with enemies. That also fits the overall gameplay. This game isnt the easiest. Mistakes you can pay permanent death in the game. I enjoy a challenging game and you learn to play diffrent tactics.


Even tough I listed a lot of positive things there are still bad things that sometimes make me hate this game:

-Enemys: I listed above their unique being and great lookout. Their skills and beeing is the same. You will find out really early that even in a low lvl dungeon there hides an enemy that can  kill you with 1 hit and you dont stand a chance. Some enemies are just beyong hard and even grinding wont help you all the time. Play carefully and read everything and every hint in the battle and your memos it will/can save your life and give you tips how to beat them.

- Enemylvl: Connecting with the point above. Grinding helps you sometimes even more after a NG+, but a few bosses will show up with same highest level in your party. WATCH OUT. Also the level can jump from the same as you to about 10+ level higher  than your team.

-Class Change: I am happy we got this function. (can change a few times and get a few skilsl of each class you changed) The bad thing to keep if from beeing broken (it seems) is that you loose HALF of your lvl of the hero! Thats to much in my opinion and keeps me from changing.

- Items: Altough i love the diffent type of items I hate the way how to get a few.  Some items are essential to even pass a few stages of the game. (Epic hard boss battles the endgame for example!) And a few you can only buy 10 times each game (new games add 10 again) 10 revive items sounds a lot but there will be a lot of situations you will need them. Choose wisely! Read the discription and store them in the storage or you will waste them.

- Hearts/Lifepoints: Each character can have between 1-3 hearts. Everytime the character dies he looses a heart. If he loose all his hearts the character fanishes forever. No chance of getting them back. (except the main character revive him as often as you want) The first time it happend to me I was just: WHAT he is gone forever? So dont foreget to check your hearts and revive your partymembers/hearts early enough.

- Recovery/treat death. I mentioned the hearts above. The "Base" got the function instant recovery or normaly recovery the same is for the hearts. Instant recovery costs a lot of money, normal recovery takes a looong time. (a few days ingame time sometimes it feels like ages.


Overall a great game. I would buy it again and would hope for a DLC or SoSC2. Love it but it isnt the right  for everyone. I think a lot dislike it for the difficulty and the grinding. I like it. It helps me play careful and cautious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198366683470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 5901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4582, 'last_played': 1551549195}
review:
絵は綺麗。　音楽も悪くない。　どこか昔懐かしい、レトロなダンジョンゲーム。　ストーリーもまぁまぁ。　オートでマップ歩行できたり、戦闘出来る機能は花マル。　しかし、ゲーム構成がよろしくない。　やることがあまりないので（イベ・ミッションが少ない）、レベル上げ（装備ドロップあるけど）のためだけにウロチョロと同じ場所を延々と彷徨い続ける。　そのくせ、レベル上昇には時間かかるんで、うざいし、だるい。　しかも、職替えするたびに、キャラレベルが下がってしまう。　何をしても、サクサク感はなく、いつまでもダラダラ延々と経験値稼ぎ。　

ビギナーレベルが普通の難易度――それでも自分の２倍のレベルぐらいの敵が当たり前のように出てくるし、魔法禁止や、ダメージフロアのみのマップとかあるし、販売されているアイテム数（回復系すら）にも限りがあるんで、鬼畜。　中ボスにアタッカーの（ニンジャですら）攻撃全然当たらないわ、即死攻撃来るわ（もともと２や３しかないLPが尽きると、延々と育ててきたキャラ消滅）、前代未聞のサドゲー。　中盤まで来たからクリアはしたいけど、果たしてそこまで行きつけるか……？

author: {'steamid': '76561198009317041', 'num_games_owned': 597, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 4259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1628, 'last_played': 1552524653}
review:
This game is a game made for fans of classic wizardries(5 and before) and and games like that. if you touched games like that and decided that's not your field of interest, well this is not for you.
with that out of the way, i can say that Stranger of Sword City is a very good game. it picks all the good stuff from classic wizardry and tweaks them just enough to make it a different game but that still feels like it, without changing it mechanically into something more jrpg-like 


i almost did not got this game, it just looked like a generic wizardry clone. and boy i was wrong. this is one of those rare games where you cannot say "oh it does things in a new way that games before it did not", is the whole package and how everything interconnects that is good.
if you go and read the classes descriptions, the spells, its mechanics and so... you won't be impressed. till you play the game.
a example: all of the fighting classes have special attacks but they neither became simple attack spells with weapons that use mp or (for most part) a universal replacement for normal attacks. each every single special attack has a tradeoff to it that never fully replaces the normal attack but at the same time they do cause a massive impact in combat... but if you just read a list of class skills, all you gonna see is "class A has 4 attack skills.... class B has 3.... how original"

this level of fine point balancing is everywhere in the game, and it tells how much love was poured into this and how well the devs knew the genre, there no way for me to not recommend it for anyone who's into the genre

author: {'steamid': '76561198009021982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 2076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1835, 'last_played': 1649609402}
review:
Interesting hard dungeon crawler game. You have a party of 6 (3 front/3 back) characters and 10 extra sitting at the base in case you need to change your party setup or when your characters lose a heart and need some time to recover. Dying in game is dangerous, characters can die at most 3 times depending on their age after that they are gone forever.

The game has an interesting way to farm items. You ambush groups of enemies and kill leaders before they flee with chests.

There are unique items that you can get. There is a system in a game when you can donate this item and this allows you to be able to find it again with better stats.

There is a class change system that you can use to gather some skills from different classes that will allow you to customize your characters better.

The game scares you with enemy levels. In your first dungeon when you are level 1 you can meet enemies of level 15 or higher. Sometimes you can still beat them. On level 13 with one class change you can beat level 35 enemies.

The amount of interesting and unusual features, plus difficulty of the game that does not only depends on stats but also on you knowing the enemy and how to apply your skills makes this game very interesting for people who appreciate dungeon crawlers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036000851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 18289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17619, 'last_played': 1546437806}
review:
PC版初代ウィザードリィ以降で一番はまったRPGです。
300時間以上かけてメインシナリオをクリアーした感想です。
楽しみながら参考情報なしで実績も全解除できました。

[ 良かった点 ]
・随所にウィザードリィへのレスペクトが感じられました。
・抜群の操作性
　戦闘や移動など、ストレスなく操作できます。
　PC版のWizと同じく、ダンジョン探索をストレスなく行えます。
・絶妙なゲームバランス
　バランスが絶妙です。強くなっても死ぬときは死にます。
　レベルを上げても一人だけが生き残り、ギリギリの状態で帰還する緊張感を味わえます。
　必須とされる職業がないので、初期に作成したメンバーでも攻略できます。
　また、個性的な職業を組み合わせても楽しめました。
・豊富なアイテム
　アイテムの種類が豊富で、どんなアイテムがでてくるかとドキドキ感がたまりません。
　職業固有の物もあるため、自然と色々なメンバーを成長させたくなります。
・自由度の高さ
　これが一番はまった原因かと思います。
　シナリオが出しゃばらず、特定の一本道プレーを強制されません。
　レベル上げやアイテム集めに専念することもできます。
　一方通行でなく、レベルを上げた後に低レベルで苦労したダンジョンを探索できるため、成長を実感できます。
　個人的にパーティが強くなったら弱い敵が出てこないものや、敵の場所が決まっていて一度倒したら二度と出現しなくなるRPG（マイトアンドマジック３以降や昔のザナドゥ）は好みではありません...
・よく練られたシナリオ
　初代のウィザードリィとは一番異なる点ですが、シナリオも楽しめました。
　レベルを上げたら自然に進めたくなるようなシナリオでした。
　XBOX版に付属している関連小説も後から購入してしまいました。

[ マイナス点 ]
・睡眠時間を削って夜な夜なプレーをしたため家族にあきれられました....
・Win10完全対応版があれば...

author: {'steamid': '76561198027882328', 'num_games_owned': 1730, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2742, 'last_played': 1637303443}
review:
Obnoxiously difficult. Bosses will frequently one-shot characters, either with an instant-kill attack (which can be blocked, past a certain point in the game or when certain classes get to a certain level) or by doing amounts of damage that are impossible to live through. It wouldn't be a huge problem if a single character could get one-shot by an attack, since you have 6. But it's very much possible for multiple characters to die turn 1. Not only that, but if characters die too many times (1-3 depending on their age) they permanently disappear.

Do not buy unless you are willing to read a guide, have a large amount of patience for frustration/repetition, and are fine with random game overs/character deaths that you have little/no control over. This isn't Dark Souls' kind of difficulty, where getting better makes the game easier. This is beating your head against a wall until the molecules in the wall line up perfectly so that your head goes through it. And then you die, because your head is inside a wall.

If you want a dungeon-crawler RPG that respects your time, I'd recommend Wizardry 8, Shining in the Darkness, Paper Sorcerer, Legend of Grimrock, or Might & Magic X.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992998161', 'num_games_owned': 1369, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 5654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5654, 'last_played': 1503419981}
review:
A very accessible blobber.
Easy to get into, nice menus that dont make you bend over backwards for repetitious shit like old blobbers. Automapping and abilities move from map.
Has great music. Two art styles that are "amazing" and "anime". Definitely go with amazing.

Its dungeons are very simplistic. You dont get claustrophobic dungeons and definitely never get lost.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129495050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1543032098}
review:
Normally I'd never write a bad review simply because a game doesn't start up on my computer, but a LOT of people have not only got the same exact issue, but have also had it since Nov of 2017. I checked the discussions page and I only found one response that MIGHT be from a dev, but when their answer didn't help, all contact was broken. The fact that this game is on sale when it's still buggy to the point where it's unplayable, annoys me. 

Bottom line: If you buy it and you get a white screen that says Not Responding, refund the game. You will not find a solution to the problem. The game also apparently crashes at other times as well...so often, the discussions page has a whole section on it. 

Not good if the developers aren't talking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030880843', 'num_games_owned': 2496, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1530957822}
review: I really don't know why I'm attracted to this in-a-way rather general VN-like RPG. Maybe, maybe it's because of pretty characters. Yes, sometimes that's enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127462528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1543960365}
review: Simples, mas contém uma boa quantia de mecânicas, classes e times para formar, o jogo é bem divertido, mas, além de ter uma história fraca (pelo menos no início não há nada de notável nela), eu pessoalmente não acho que ele vale o preço integral dele. Caso goste de jogos de RPG, compre ele quando estiver na promoção.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013695344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1311, 'last_played': 1547641212}
review:
Un des meilleurs Dungeon Crawler auquel j'ai joué, l'univers et l'histoire reste plaisant à suivre (même si on reste l'élu d'une certaine manière..) la DA du jeu type Dark Fantasy est tout simplement superbe et notamment les artworks des personnages (Type A) et les boss. 

Le jeu peut être décourageant parfois il est vrai, lorsqu'un de tes meilleurs guerriers stuffé aux petits oignons se fait one-shot par un coup critique funeste ou par un mob que tu as clairement sous-estimé et il ne faut pas être non plus allergique au grinding c'est certain. Mais c'est simplement car la difficulté est au rendez-vous, une difficulté qu'on ne trouve plus de nos jours dans les JRPG modernes, il faut apprendre à constituer un groupe solide, à prévoir une équipe en backup, à anticiper les changements de classes et à quel niveau le faire...

Un aspect du jeu intéressant est le système de loot basé sur des zones à embuscade de mobs avec difficulté accrue, c'est fun et le jeu sait punir une trop grande cupidité de votre part.

Soyez prévenu : La mort d'un personnage se paye au prix cher. Si le challenge ne vous fait pas peur et qu'au contraire elle vous stimule alors ce jeu est fait pour vous.

Good luck Stranger ! Que la RNG soit avec vous.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968994186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1616081879}
review:
Game type: Dungeon Crawler

Player focus:  Single player; narrative driven player vs. environment game play.

Description: A first person perspective “dungeon crawl” game the game holds the same gameplay as games such as Legend Of Grimrock or Might & Magic 10: Legacy. Developed by Experience Inc. & published by Nippon Ichi Software America the game does not offer any DLC for sale. With an average length of 50 to 60 hours (based on reports found via Google) the game appears (from the review period of 6 hours of play time) to offer little in the way of replayability as all classes are available from the start. Once the story is played through there’s little incentive to go through, once again, to try different builds or story lines.

Game Mechanics: Game play takes place in a corridor “dungeon” (which includes outside areas). The map is divided into equal size squares with time & movement being based on movement from square to square. It fits the standard style of a dungeon crawl game. Movement can be done via wasd+qe or using the mouse to activate contextual direction prompts on screen. Combat takes place via turn based commands where the player first inputs their options & then watches as they play out & awaits the computer’s opposing commands. The cycle continues until one side kills all of the opposing side.
With no physics to speak of the game engine is light weight & does not have long loading times in response. There are no 3D graphics with player character & enemy units being display via high quality portraits. Map graphics use what appears to be some form of perspective projection with textures stretching & blurring based on the camera’s location.
Difficulty wise the game appears decently difficult but mostly due to a lack of resources in the early game. With one character dying early on I was not able to revive said character due to the rather large sum of currency the game asks for reviving… leading to slower game play progression & an underpowered party.
Controls are referenced in controller lingo & while keyboard & mouse controls do work the game lacks polish in this regard with on screen prompts always being referenced in a corresponding controller button.

Story: While not deeply into the story at only 6 hours of playtime the story so far has presented itself as a “human world normal person encounters established fantasy world thereby becoming the chosen one” story. Others speaking on the story have indicated there are some twists to the story but one does not expect these to be outside the normal set of tropes for such a setting.

Art Style/Graphics:The map graphics are quality textures that are displayed in varying qualities. If a texture is observed directly, such as the tiles one must cross while adventuring, quality is relatively pleasant  with a few set pieces helping populate an otherwise barren “dungeon”.
The user interface graphics are simple; being presented with edged text boxes & complementary coloured prompts & highlights they neither detract nor enhance gameplay.
Character portraits are the game’s strong point. These are quite often lovely to look at with eye catching highlights & deep colours. However, at least in the case of the player portraits, they can also detract from the game play as several of the provided portraits use bright, cheerful colour schemes which do not seem to fit with rest of the game’s set pieces at all.

Sound/Music: With most game interactions (selecting an option for instance) being indicated with a simple click the interface sounds are minimal. The music does not tend to stand out & does not really engage one to the story.
Many of the dialogs are voiced, however since the game originated as a Asian game all voices are in a Asian dialect as NISA did not see fit to include voice acting in the porting process.

Target/Suggested Audience: With the game play being a bit on the harder side but also more simplistic then similar games the target audience appears to be individuals who don’t mind gameplay grind but want an accompanying story.

Pricing: Currently $21 Canadian on Steam & no DLC offered the game is overpriced compared to more engaging games of the same theme such as the fore mentioned Legend Of Grimrock which can be had for only $15 at the time of writing.

Summary of Pros: Lovely character & enemy portraits, ability to import one’s own portraits. Short load times.

Summary of Cons: Overpriced, game play that’s simplistic compared to competitors, textures that are blurry during world exploration, seemingly little motivation for replay. NISA driven port to English & PC is unpolished with keyboard/mouse support being tacked on & no English translation for audio.

Reviewed copy obtained via: Direct Steam purchase.

Recommendation Level: Not recommended; other products of similar design have better presentation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063588126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 20494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2439, 'last_played': 1542747873}
review:
Первые впечатления за 10 часов игры...

Понравилось:
1. Хоть по сути это д.-краулер, но мне она напомнила игры старой школы типа Might&Magic 3-5. Ностальгия...
2. Боевая система довольно разнообразная, много умений, магии и всего, что необходимо для интересной боёвки.
3. Развитие персов очень необычное - можно до 5 раз менять класс персов, усиливая в чём-то их...Это необычно и интеерсно.
4. Конечно отличный рисованный арт всего и вся. Очень круто и приятно глазу.
5. Можно довольно тонко для таких игр настроить своих персов при создании - от имеющихся артов до своих картинок, настройка голоса, расы, роли в команде.

Сомнительно:
1. Сейвы только на базе в городе. Хотя...только хардкор! =) 
2. НЕТ РУССКОГО ЯЗЫКА. Конечно, суть хватаешь, но приятнее на родном...Сюжет меня лично мало интересует. Для этого есть художественная литература...
3. Опять же хардкор - некторых боссов трудно найти не прочитав вики. Хотя для некторых jrpg это довольно характерно.

Нет ничего что бы мне конекртно не понравилось как некторым кто отписался ранее...

Я бы рекомендовал игру тем кому нравились игры типа Might&Magic 3-5 и просто кому нравится хорошая боёвка с интресным развитием персов.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102655125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1539832658}
review:
Alot of people are buying it for the ability to add custom portraits into the game so you can have Captain Crunch as your Main Character or something as goofy as that.

Personally i find the game to be Boring and unimaginitive on many fronts but mainly the way the world looks and how simple and dull battle is.

Basically just a Test game made by newer developers that japan likes to do sometimes because people will still buy them. For me id give a hard pass even for low amount of cost they are charging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082788781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1539812160}
review:
Extremely unintuitive. The first hour of the game is just throwing you into menus and menus without you even knowing what the hell to do. I've been trying to be very cautious and aware of what the game tells me to do but the imbalanced combat, the completely weird levels of every character and the weird ass perspective are nothing for me. 

Get Etrian Odysee for DS. You'll have a version of this game that is actually good, actually even playable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012021962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1923, 'last_played': 1536162485}
review:
絵がきれい以外、良い所のないゲームだ。面白い要素一つもない。
ゲームバランスが悪く、序盤から偶に一般の敵より10レベルも高いザコ敵が現れて、逃走か全滅しかない。
ゲームの進行に関わるキーアイテムは、特定のエリアで待ち伏せをしないと入手できない。しかも、待ち伏せをしても、必ず入手できるとは限らない。それに、待ち伏せには制限がかけられ、できなくなったら、一旦町に戻って出直す必要がある。
マップはそんなに広くないから、往復にはそんなに時間が掛からないけど、ずっと同じ事を繰り返して苦痛だった。

自分は、キャラ作りに時間を使いすぎで、気が付いたら返金ができなくなって、プレイしないと損だから最後までやろうと思ったが、もう我慢の限界だ。
みなさん、もし買おうとしたら、キャラ作りは手短に、早く実際プレイしてみた方が良いと思う。

author: {'steamid': '76561198141347859', 'num_games_owned': 628, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 3899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3899, 'last_played': 1537957816}
review:
本編を一応クリアしてエンディングまで見たのでレビューを書こうかと思います。

[h1]パーティーメンバーの画像を自分の好きなものにできる事以外の魅力がない[/h1]
なろう小説レベルのシナリオとか、事実上の完全版が携帯ゲーム機のPS vitaで発売されているとか、そんな不満がどうでもよくなるぐらいのSteam版唯一の魅力、それが標準で実装されているキャラ繪の差し替え機能です。
正直、自分の好きな画像を使ってキャラメイクができるDRPGってだけで金出して買う価値があります。[spoiler] 世界樹の迷宮のキャラなんか使った日には「本家もこういうUIで出してほしい」って思っちゃうほどに。[/spoiler]この機能がなければ、どうしようもないレベルでダメなゲームでした。

が、そんな唯一の魅力を覆すぐらいゲームとしてのシステム設計が酷い。。。
詳細は他の方のレビューにも記載があるので割愛しますが、羅列するとこんな感じです。

[list]
    [*]パーティーメンバーの死亡が事実上許されないので、常に余裕で勝てるまで鍛えながら進めなきゃいけない(1人でも死んだら即リセット)
    [*]ダンジョンのショートカットを開通させても、ランダムでそれが閉鎖されてしまう
    [*]レベルアップをさせるのに逐一ステータス画面を開かなきゃいけない(宿屋でレベルアップとか自動でレベルアップとかそういうのがない)
    [*]レベルがステータスに与える影響力が大き過ぎてレベル差で極端に戦闘難易度が変わる割に、レベルが極端に上がり辛い(レベル上げポイントなるものが一応ゲーム内で用意されているのに)
    [*]転職システムなるものが存在するが転職によるレベルダウンが激しく、前述のレベルの仕様もあって本編クリアまでは事実上の死にシステムになっている
[/list]

総評を言えば、ぶっちゃけセール時の価格ですら割高だと思います。
[spoiler] Steamストアだとおま値なので、Humbleストア等の外部ストアをセール時に利用した方がいいです。[/spoiler]
システムさえしっかりしていればオススメできるのですが、上記の通り余りにも酷い点が多過ぎて、とても人様にお勧めできるような代物ではないです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198185613359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6146, 'last_played': 1534234307}
review:
第一次玩DRPG，游戏体验很不错，可以打8/10分。
说到难度，其实也还好，我因为已经被魂系列、群星和EVE训练成了抖M，所以并没有感觉死亡惩罚、缺乏存档点之类的是什么大问题，无非是每次出门之前需要先计划好探索范围而已。
除了迷宫贴图有点简陋以外各方面硬素质都是顶级水平，玩起来很享受。
比较有意思的是养成系统，特别是因为有转职功能的存在，是有可能培养出很多丧心病狂的阵容的（比如骑士转职舞娘，可以站己方后排无视射程挥舞巨锤用4连击砸对方后排，或者用一个闪避高的职业转武士，用修罗无限砍boss砍到死…………）。


要说缺点就是一些教程的出现实在太迟了，等你把游戏的系统、技能都熟悉了，再想改变养成计划已经很困难了，真的有心养成，可以试试二周目………………

author: {'steamid': '76561197991732326', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 8653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8567, 'last_played': 1619656107}
review:
The game starts with the news of plane crashing down, and you was in the plane, but instead of dying, you find yourself taken to another world, Escarion - a place, where you are not the only one transported, as lot of stuff from our world often end there, as there is lot of broken planes, trains and even ships around, in this place you character is called a "Stranger", because people from other world, are not only stranger in this place, but wield different powers here. But you soon get yourself in a trouble as misterious stranger lead you to a trap only to be saved by another Stranger, a young girl named Riu, which also came from our world, she saves you and take you to the Sword City - from this point on - begin your adventures as a "Stranger in Sword City" a Dungeon Crawler from Experience published by Nisa.

Now while you start with a single character at the beginning, you can (and should) create a party, the game offer the classic array of classes, but each one have some unique features - Knight (which have skills based in attacking enemies in rows and other to protect the party), Samurai (which focus in dual wielding, attacking enemies in lines and engaging in one to one duels) , Fighter (which can concentrate to unleash powerfull attacks), Ranger (focused in long range and tie down enemies), Ninja (with critical hit based skills and evasion based skills), Dancer (which have a variety of skills, which allow them thing like using two or more item at once, hitting enemies no matter their position), Cleric (Healing and Buff magic) and Wizard (Attack and buff spells).

The game features a "Life Point" system, each character will have a certain amount of "Life points" depending on their age (younger character get more while older less) and each time a character dies a point will be lost, if all points are lost them the character will be lost forever, thankfully, there is both items (but rare) which heal Life and you can recover them by resting on the Stranger´s base with either time or gold (instantly). However, your main character, due story reasons, isn´t affect by Life Point loss despite how many times they might die (but this is only for the MC the rest of the party work as normal).

Most of the game will be around finding and hunting the Lineage types of each map, unique monsters encounters that often require some condition to me meet, defeating them wield Blood Crystals, which could be given to three NPCs, each one unlocks special abilities, called Divinity and also set which ending you might see - Riu will lead to the Neutral ending, Marilith to the Good ending and Alma to the Bad ending. By doing this hunts you unlock more of the story and newer maps to go.

The Divinity is one of the game most curious features, as you characters attack enemies they will gain Morale, and his could be spend using the Divinity, each one have different effects, such as giving your whole party ability to attack first, recover HP each turn, protect from certain spells and other types of buffs - knowing how to use them will be often very crucial during both Lineage types and Boss battles, which might often require a careful timing.

The ambush system is another of interesting features of the game, where instead of grind random encounters around the map, your major source of XP and gear will come from the from the "Ambush Points" scattered in each map, in this places, by spending a bit of Morale, you can set, as much the name suggest, an ambush, where you might find different monster groups, each one carrying a potential treasure, where you can choose to attack them or let them pass (in case their treasure isn´t good or they are to powerful) and see if you can spot another one. Also majority of the Lineage types you face will be in ambush points.

This system mean you have much wider control when you grind, since you can have much better idea of what might get from the encounter and therefore, grind almost exactly what you need. Like if you need a new Katana, you might just go around a map where in ambush points you might find monster parties carrying Katana chests and ambush them.

There is also a system for multiclass your characters, where at any point you can chance your class to another one (but at half your current class level, so if you are 20 Level Knight and change to Samurai, you will be at level 10), but you allow to carry around some skills for the previous class, with the Token skills, at certain levels, each class gain certain Token Skill points, each one let you choose a skill from the previous class to keep around (and you can change them at anytime). Using this system is often crucial at late game, where you might need a combination of different class skills to survive.

Another fun feature, is that you can choose the art style of the game, as the game features to main artists, one with a more high fantasy and another more dark fantasy in style. You can also set up your own custom portraits too. Note: the screenshots used in the review are from the more dark fantasy themed art.

The game it is very good, the pace feels right, thanks to both the grid based maps never felling to huge or small and even the grind isn´t much a issue, as you have much better control of what you might get, while Lineage battles offer a interesting challenge. It is important to add, the PC version is so called "White Palace"(白の王宮) version, because there is different versions of the game, the vita is the "Black Palace"(黒の宮殿) the major different between them is some Lineage bosses and if the one of the end dungeons is either the Black Palace of the White Palace.  After the main story, which isn´t much very long by itself, but leveling up and hunting gear might take its time, there is some post game content - the first based around the so called White/Black Palace map, the second is about visiting four new dungeons with some new bosses, which are extra hard. By last, there is a NG plus system too.

Downsides? I do admit, that while there might be some, most of them where rather minimal, like some bosses can be really hard without good divinity skills, like ones which cast charm, which require you to have a certain divinity skill in hand and ready to cast or risk losing control of the situation, but, again this rather minimal, as the game kind warn you to have this skill ready by time bosses start to use it. However, depending of which ending you are looking that might mean straying away a bit or twice (spoilers: there is a single boss, which cast charm twice, so you might need a upgrade version of the skill which protect you two times from charm). Also a few bosses have skills which can instantly kill a character if you aren´t ready.

One final point, the game music is gorgeous, specially, the lineage music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018893258', 'num_games_owned': 3719, 'num_reviews': 744, 'playtime_forever': 4859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4799, 'last_played': 1534035429}
review:
WizardryライクDRPG。
現代人が異世界に飛ばされ「血統種」という敵を倒すために各地のダンジョンを探索しているうちに異世界の運命を左右していくというストーリーで、6人までのパーティーを結成してダンジョンを探索してくオーソドックスな内容のゲームだ。「死亡」が重く設定され「待ち伏せ」というトレハンができることが特徴となっている。

[ゲーム内容]
ストアページには「黒の宮殿」とあるが実際は「白の王宮」だ。なぜこんな紛らわしいことをそのままにしておくのか理解に苦しむ。

[戦闘バランス]
死亡ペナルティが重いに関わらず、うっかりすると死亡するような場面が多い。ボス戦の初見殺しに近いような攻撃や、普通の敵に紛れ込んでいる高レベルの敵、乱入してくる強敵など、理不尽に思えることは多いと思う。しかし、それらは対策さえできれば大抵は防げるものだ。このゲームのスキルは効果的なものが多く、特に防御関係スキルは使い方次第で戦局を好転させることが可能だ。戦闘序盤をスキルでしのいでバフを積み上げていけばごり押しすることもできる。それでも、敵の即死攻撃、特に一部のボスの開幕レクイエム(即死魔法)などで死ぬときは死ぬ。
敵が強いと感じても命中や回避などはレベルに依存しているようなので、どうにもならなくても最悪レベルさえ上がればなんとかなると思う。

[死亡ペナルティ]
死亡ペナルティは重い。死亡すると生命点というポイントが減っていき、生命点がなくなると蘇生できずにロストとなる。
死亡したキャラを蘇生するとしたら高額な金か長期の時間経過を必要とする。これは生命点の回復についても同様だ。

[転職]
転職は非常に有用な手段だ。このゲームではスキルの使い方が重要なので転職でキャラに多くのスキルを使えるようにするのは攻略を楽にしてくれる。
転職をするとレベルが半減しHPやMP、レベル依存の能力値が下がるが、特性値(ステータス)は下がらないので高ランクアイテムを装備でき、十分に即戦力として転職キャラをそのまま活躍させることができる。その反面、1周目では転職前のレベルを越えないとレベルアップしても特性値ポイントが貰えないという制限がある。また、レベルが下がることでドロップアイテムの質も落ちるので、転職後のレベリングは少し退屈かもしれない。

[待ち伏せ]
待ち伏せポイントで士気を消費して待ち伏せすると、宝箱を持った敵が登場しそれらを倒して宝箱の罠を解除すると確実にアイテムが手に入る。待ち伏せで敵が出現すると敵と宝箱に入っているアイテムのタイプを見ることができる。欲しいアイテムタイプでなかったら見過すことで新たな敵と宝箱が出る。欲しいアイテムタイプが出るまで見過ごすのも手だが、見過した回数が増えるごとに先制攻撃される可能性が高くなる。
この待ち伏せシステムがあるためか通常戦闘のドロップや店の在庫は絞られているので、装備アイテムが欲しいなら待ち伏せ、消費アイテムが欲しいならアイテムシンボルを探してダンジョン探索という形になっている。

[ユニークアイテム]
ユニークアイテムは1周回につき同じものは1つしか手に入らない。例えば、村正というアイテムを1つ手に入れたら、もう1つ手に入れるには次の周回となる。
また、弱いユニークはランダムで出現するムミックというキャラに渡せば、再度手に入れ直すことが可能だ。例えば、村正+1を持っていて性能が気に入らないならムミックに渡せば、村正+1は失うが新たに村正+3など以前より性能が良いものがドロップする可能性がある。ただし、ムミックではなく商店に間違って売ってしまった場合はその周回では2度と手に入れることはできない。

[血統種(ボス)の再討伐]
倒した血統種はゲーム中盤からランダムで再登場する。血統種と再戦できるが倒してもあまり旨味が無い。復活した血統種はワープできる魔石を占領して使用できないようにしているので「倒さないと不便だから仕方なく倒す」というものになってしまっている。

私はWizライクDRPGを「BUSIN」と「迷宮クロスブラッド」しかやったことがないので、他のWizライクDRPGとの比較を抜きにして書く。
スキルの使い分けが面白い戦闘のゲームだと思う。初めの戦闘では対応できない攻撃はあるが、スキルを上手く使い分けていけば思ったよりも理不尽さは少ない。このゲームを高難易度に至らしめているのは死亡ペナルティの重さだと思う。死亡ペナルティはもう少し緩和しても良かったのではないかと思う。それを除けば、全体的には良く出来たゲームだという印象だ。UIや操作系統は快適にプレイできるようになっていることも良い。
このゲームの特徴の1つである「待ち伏せ」には良いところと悪いところがある。待ち伏せで効率良くトレハンができるかと思えばいくつかの制限がある。士気が必要であることから効率良くトレハンしていくには待ち伏せポイントのルートを考える必要がある。待ち伏せを使わせるために他のアイテム入手の機会が絞られていることや、出現する敵によってドロップするアイテムのタイプが偏る、出現する敵のパターンが多いわけではないのでまた同じ顔ぶれの敵と延々と戦っていくはめになることなどがある。それでもルートを決めて、良いアイテムの1つや2つ出れば気にならない程度だと思う。
あと、血統種の再討伐はただ面倒なだけなので魔石解放以外に倒すメリットがあったら良かったと思う。アイテム欄のユニーク品をひと目で判別できるようにして欲しかった。
死亡ペナルティが重いことを許容できる(またはリセットで妥協できる)ならダンジョン探索RPGとしてはオススメのゲームだ。

author: {'steamid': '76561197986104200', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1483, 'last_played': 1535352196}
review:
If you think you'll like the game you probably will.  Great art, a good amount of depth and variation available, great atmosphere. 

If they were to make a second that has character animations and slightly more detail and effects, it would get AAA sales and respect.   I thought long before buying it and read many reviews and criticisms, but I'm really glad I picked it up.  I'll be sinking MANY hours in this over time and it is well seated within my game playlist rotation.

I would recommend reading the forum thread regarding things people wish they knew when they started, it will equip you with what you need to know to be able to enjoy the tango with this games ever-present threat and ability to kill you if you disrespect the real game at hand between taking risks for enticing rewards and gear while meanwhile building a roster of characters that will earn you money while your main party is out braving the "dungeons" for hijacked pillaging and quest or exploration rewards.

I look forward to see how the story develops as there is a long way for me yet to go, while I plot and build my character's builds and gear to be able to survive what I find around that next new area or surprise encounter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198236937684', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1582807509}
review:
For me Stranger of Sword City is the worst Dungeon Crawler so far.

Difficulty change in the middle of a map why? XP rate is as low as it can be. My characters are lvl 10 and thats it after 7.5 hours. Don't expect any of the main story before you grind your ass off. Shop items like phoenix feathers are limited this is complete bullshit. Characters have EXTRA LIVES?! and to refill them you have to grind your ass off AGAIN because you have no money?! If you don't do it there are gone for good after 1-3 deaths. Yeah great shit and so much fun you can create new characters woohooo this is just annoying.

It's not a must play game
it's not fun
it's just one of the worst dungeon crawler

author: {'steamid': '76561197979991287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2033, 'last_played': 1482251163}
review:
This was very close to a non-recommended title for me, but the people who don't mind the 1 nagging con, will absolutely love this game.

It's difficult for me to recommend this game, despite all of the excellent things it has going for it.

*Gameplay is fun
*The art & music are most pleasing
*The character interactions feel a lot better than in your typical JRPG (technically Dungeon Crawler, in this case)
*Overall, the feel of the game is incredible

The one massive nagging thing, as with every Nis title in existence, is the endless, pointless, in relatively profitless grinding. Grinding to the point where the good feeling is sucked from the game. Any notions of a story are lost in the sea of endless battles. And every time you grind hard, get ahead, and feel like you've made enough improvement to move forward unhindered; the very next dungeon vaults you into peasantry once again. Then, when you believe you've actually made a significant dent, you reach the "next tier" where your characters are seasoned veterans compared to a few hours ago, but they're no better than beginning adventurers when you travel to your next destination.

Every
Nis
Game
Does
This.

If you don't mind the endless grind, I practically implore you to check out this real gem of an artistic creation. If you do, avoid it like the plague.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080437812', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 5024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2913, 'last_played': 1532286175}
review:
Não se deixe enganar pela bela arte do jogo. Stranger of Sword City é um jogo bonito, com mecânicas e interfaces simples, mas que escondem uma dificuldade de deixar qualquer "cabra macho" parecer um "pintinho".

O jogo é um Dungeon Crawler de respeito, que exige do jogador a total compreensão dos elementos da batalha para "tentar" não morrer. Sim, esse jogo exige que você tenha o devido respeito para com os inimigos, pois foge do padrão de dificuldade que estamos habituados.

A premissa do jogo, bastante dolorosa, exige sacrifícios em momentos bem delicados, o que requer uma dosa bem cavalar de adrenalina para seguir em frente. Entretanto, a morte não significa essencialmente o fim, mas um olhar mais contundente da dificuldade que ele entrega ao jogador: morreu, erga um novo exército e siga em frente.

A história, um tanto quanto clichê, esconde seus momentos dramáticos, aliada à dificuldade do jogo que EXIGE MUITA PACIÊNCIA DO JOGADOR. O sistema de aquisição de armas (grind) é muito original e desafiante: inimigos mais fortes são ossos duros de matar, mas escondem recompensas valiosas. A música é instigante e oferece trilha sonora bem consistentes.

Esse jogo oferece uma dificuldade bem justa, mas altamente desafiante; diferente de  Darkest Dungeons, que é injusta, depende da sorte e oferece um prisma bem sádico aos jogadores.

Apenas joguem, galera.

JOGO EXTREMAMENTE RECOMENDADO!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198293999376', 'num_games_owned': 18, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1693607321}

author: {'steamid': '76561197984211717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 1664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1644, 'last_played': 1710596994}
review:
จริงละที่ว่า ณ ปัจจุบันเราอาจจะมีเกมแนว Dungeon Crawler สุดล้ำให้ได้เลือกหยิบจับกันก็เยอะ กระนั้นบางครั้งบางที มันก็ต้องมีบ้างละที่เราคิดอยากที่จะหยิบจับเกมที่ให้อารมณ์เก่า ๆ อย่าง Wizardry กลับมาเล่นบ้าง ซึ่ง "Stranger of Sword City" ก็เป็นเกมที่สามารถจะตอบโจทย์ดังกล่าวให้กับคุณได้ ถึงแม้ว่ารูปร่างหน้าตาและ Gameplay ของมันจะทำให้เกมเมอร์ยุคใหม่ร้องยี้เมื่อได้เล่น แต่สำหรับเกมเมอร์ยุคเก่าเช่นผม ต้องขอสารภาพว่า Stranger of Sword City จัดได้เป็นเกมที่ให้อรรถรสอันน่ารื่นรมย์อยู่ไม่น้อยตอนที่ได้เล่น

Gameplay หลัก ๆ ของเกมนั้นก็จะเป็นเหมือนดังเช่นเกมแนว Dungeon Crawler ที่คุณนั้นคุ้นเคย คุณจะได้จัดทีมที่ประกอบไปด้วยสมาชิก 6 คนเพื่อบุกตะลุยไปในดันเจี้ยนแบบ Grid เพื่อต่อสู้กับมอนสเตอร์เพื่อฟาร์มหา Items และ EXPs แต่สิ่งที่ทำให้เกมนี้แตกต่างก็คือตัวเกมมีระบบ Ambush (ซุ่มโจมตี) คุณสามารถที่จะพาทีมไปดักรออยู่ ณ จุดอันจำเพาะเจาะจงเพื่อดักตีหัวมอนสเตอร์และฟาร์มหาไอเท็มและค่าประสบการณ์จากพวกมันได้ นี่ทำให้การ Grind ภายในเกมนั้นค่อนข้างจะสะดวกกว่าเกมอื่น ๆ พอสมควรเพราะคุณไม่จำเป็นที่จะต้องเดินไปทั่วเพียงเพื่อจะหามอนสเตอร์สักตัวมาตีหัวและปลดทรัพย์

จุดที่ผมชอบที่สุดเกี่ยวกับเกมนี้ก็คงจะเป็นระบบพัฒนาตัวละครของเกม เพราะนอกจากเราจะได้ปรับแต่ง Attributes โดยละเอียดแล้ว ระบบอาชีพภายในเกมนั้นยังซับซ้อนและจำเป็นที่จะต้องอาศัยการวางแผนอยู่ไม่น้อย โดยตัวละครหนึ่งของคุณสามารถที่จะเปลี่ยนอาชีพได้เพียง 5 ครั้ง และเมื่อเปลี่ยนอาชีพไป แม้ lv. จะลดลงครึ่งหนึ่ง แต่คุณจะได้รับ HP/SP Bonus อีกทั้งยังมีโอกาสที่จะเลือก Skills ชุดหนึ่งเพื่อนำไปใช้ในอาชีพใหม่ได้ ภายในเกมนี้คุณจึงสามารถที่จะสร้างตัวละครที่เด่นเฉพาะทางหรือมีความสามารถเฉพาะทางได้อย่างหลากหลาย แม้ในช่วงต้นเกมจะแลดูเนือย ๆ อยู่สักหน่อยเพราะยังมีลูกเล่นให้ได้ใช้ไม่มากนัก แต่ช่วงกลางถึงปลายเกมนั้นก็สนุกและเพลินมาก ซึ่งถ้าคุณรักเกมที่ใช้ระบบ Multiclass คุณก็จะรักระบบของเกมนี้ (กระนั้นถ้าคุณวางแผนพลาดทีก็อาจจะต้องย้อนกลับไปฟาร์มกันยาว)

ในส่วนของเนื้อหานั้น แม้ในช่วงแรกจะชวนให้ระลึกถึงอนิเมะที่หลุดไปสู่ต่างโลกตามสมัยนิยม (ตัวเอกประสบอุบัติเหตุเครื่องบินตกเลยหลุดไปสู่ต่างโลก) ทว่าในช่วงปลายของเกมนั้นกลับมีจุดหักมุมที่น่าสนใจอยู่ไม่น้อย ส่วนตัวผมเองออกจะชอบเนื้อหาของเกมอยู่ไม่น้อยและถ้าคุณชอบเกมที่มีธีมแบบแฟนตาซีมืดมนหน่อย ๆ คุณก็คงจะชอบเกมนี้ (ตัวเกมมีฉากจบหลายแบบแถมมี New Game+ ด้วยนะ)

โดยรวมแล้ว "Stranger of Sword City" เป็น Dungeon Crawler แบบดั้งเดิมที่ดีงามเอามาก ๆ แม้มันอาจจะแลดูตกยุคไปสักหน่อย แต่สำหรับผู้ที่ชื่นชอบ Dungeon Crawler ยุคเก่าอย่าง Wizardry ผมก็อยากจะที่แนะนำให้คุณลองเล่นเกมนี้ กระนั้นถ้าคุณเป็นเกมเมอร์ยุคใหม่ที่ชอบแสงสีและ Gameplay สุดล้ำ คุณก็คงจะไม่เหมาะกับเกมนี้และผมขอแนะนำให้เลี่ยง

++ Dungeon Crawler แบบดั้งเดิม
+ ระบบพัฒนาตัวละครแบบ Multiclass
+ จุดหักมุมของเนื้อหา, ฉากจบที่มีมากกว่าหนึ่ง และ New Game+
+ สามารถปรับแต่ง Sprites ใช้ได้ด้วยตัวเอง
-- เกมเน้น Grind อย่างหนัก
++/-- One Hit Kill อย่างไม่คาดฝันโดยศัตรูบางตัว (แม้ผมจะชอบเพราะมันทำให้เกมท้าทายขึ้น แต่ผมเชื่อว่าเกมเมอร์ส่วนใหญ่คงจะเกลียดมัน)

author: {'steamid': '76561198048066158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1530135442}
review:
The concept is fun, and the story was ok for the short depth that I traversed. In the end I just couldn't stand this games brand of grind. It is mindnumbingly dull, I think its hook is you grind for chests so you get that small thrill of possibility over and over again, of course most chests are filled with garbage...

For me the killer was progress effeciency/fairness. An example, in the starter dungeon, i ground and ground and got my party up to level 4-6 (less than 5 average). Most fights are against level 11 hydra team, and go auto - auto - auto win. Then every now and again I would hit level 22's, (whom you can easily flee from) and lets say you want to go for it! They can one-shot your team members putting them out for 8 in-game days, that is 2-4hours of IRL grinding.  Or, and this is the kicker, if you win!, i would get 1-3% xp gain. That is a horrible payout for pushing your team. 

To reiterate the game has charm but relies on random loot drop thrill too much to overcome the repetition for me, as a working adult I don't have the time to toss off on a game of this much grind to play ratio. If you do though, and the game looks charming to you ignore my don't recommend that is toward people who have more limited time resources.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004472496', 'num_games_owned': 651, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 10400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10400, 'last_played': 1527705609}
review:
[quote=Alm]If you want to save someone, then you have to kill in exchange. That's the way the world is. But if you have to kill the filthy to create a pure, peaceful world... I don't desire a world like that.
 - Stranger of Sword City[/quote]
Если вы знакомы с играми от Experience (что на PC сомнительно, но всё же), то тут вы будете как дома. Перед нами "типичный" dungeon crawler от этих разработчиков.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=noeNA2v7u7w
[list]
    [*][u]Завязка сюжета и сам мир[/u] вызывают как минимум любопытство: главный герой (или героиня) попадает в авиакатастрофу, но не разбивается, а оказывается в довольно мрачном фэнтезийном мире. И почти тут же встречает девушку в вычурной наручной броне поверх сейлор фуку и узнает, что тут подобные "попаданцы" очень ценятся - они превосходят силой и способностями местных обитателей. А так же, что есть 3 так называемых "Сосуда" - люди, способные поглощать Кровавые камни, получаемые за убийство особых Lineage Type-монстров, в обмен на божественные благословения. Но, увы, в рамках игры ни лору, ни достойной истории попросту нет места. Жаль, потенциал был.
    [*]С [u]геймплейной точки зрения[/u] перед нами крепкий и интересный dungeon crawler. Но игра подразумевает что вы знакомы с жанром, и основы основ разжевывать не собирается: обучение сосредоточится на местных уникальных фишках вроде "засад" и "смены класса". Настоятельно рекомендую перед началом игры уделить время и разобраться с геймплейными механиками. Спойлерить в игре нечего, зато сбережете себя от фрустрации: например, критические удары тут это не просто усиленный/игнорирующий броню удар, но мгновенная смерть персонажа, а чтобы видеть жизни врагов в партии нужен рейнджер. Обычно я такое советую только power player'ам, кто хочет выжать из своих персонажей 100%, но Stranger of Sword City довольно неприветлива к новичкам, и можно довольно быстро потерять полотряда от шальных критов, обнаружить что восстановить Life Point стоит прорву денег, а уровней и снаряжения не хватает чтобы справиться с сюжетным боссом.
    [*]Отдельно отмечу великолепный [u]визуальный стиль[/u]. И даже не один, а два - в меню в любой момент его можно сменить. Второй стиль, по-мне, СЛИШКОМ анимешный (мда, не ожидал от себя такого) и я предпочел классический, но саму возможность выбора я целиком приветствую. Разве что жалко, что именно полноценных артов не так уж и много.
Мелкое неудобство - при подключении геймпада Xbox высвечиваются привычные иконки, но при игре с клавиатуры всплывают абстрактные "кнопка 1"ит.д. - приходится лезть в меню, чтобы понять что нажимать и какое-то время чтобы привыкнуть.
    [*][u]Русского языка нет[/u], но и читать тут особого нечего. 
    [*][u]Список трофеев[/u] вполне стандартный. Если вы разобрались в местных механиках, то особых проблем не будет, и гринда потребуют разве что редкие катаны да гнезда бабочек. 
Ну и ачивка на повторное убиение 20 Lineage Type - бессмысленная и раздражающая механика, заставляющая снова убивать уже побежденных боссов. Никакого челленджа и особой награды это не нёсет, зато воскрешенный монстр блокирует камень телепортации и приходится к нему топать через всю локацию на своих двоих.
[/list]
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zxwsNxX1yyA
5/10 - классический dungeon crawler, помноженный на классный дизайн и интересные механики. Достойное приобретение для поклонника жанра.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009690561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1300, 'last_played': 1553599826}
review:
A difficult-tish JRPG similar to the Wizardry series. Very polished and pleasing to look at. Tends to be a bit grindy at the beginning so stay away if thats not your thing.

 Alot of people complain about the game being too hard, but I've always found ways to get around the challenges. Interesting story and characters with multiple endings.

Very much worth it if your a fan of old school RPGs.

Tip - Don't be afraid to run, lol

author: {'steamid': '76561198048998514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 4729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4729, 'last_played': 1525083860}
review:
RPGでプレイ時間が長くなるのは普通の事だが、
このゲームでは苦痛な作業時間が多い様に感じた

以下、そのポイント
・装備選びが煩わしい
6人パーティのゲームで、装備品の数値がランダムなうえにどれを装備すると最適なのかが判断しづらく、装備管理をしているだけで時間がかかる。
こういった「数値に少しずつ違いがある装備の中から最適な装備を選ぶ」という遊びは、1人行動のアクションRPGとか、最大でも4人パーティのRPGで、それも装備箇所が武器含め4箇所くらいの少ない装備で済むような場合なら「楽しい装備選び」になるのだけど、
このゲームの場合は6人パーティで装備箇所も6箇所くらいあり、それぞれのキャラに対して「片手斧と両手剣と弓ではどれあ最適だろう？」みたいなことをやるのは正直疲れる
こういう装備箇所が多くパーティメンバーも多いRPGの場合、装備選択ではあまり悩まないように少ない装備の中から選ばせるものだろう
このゲームの場合はよりにもよって斧＋１などと装備の後ろの数値までランダムで決定されるようになっていて装備選びの時間が長くなってしまって煩わしい。

・育成が煩わしい
レベルを上げるためにはモンスターを何度も倒す必要があるのだが、
このゲームではランダムエンカウントのエンカウント率が大分低く設定してあるようで、
ただ単にダンジョンを歩き回っているだけでは敵と戦闘が出来ないようになっている
階層を行き来してシンボルエンカウントの敵を復活させるとか、独自の「待ち伏せ」システムを利用して戦闘をしないといけない
そして、必要経験値とモンスターから手に入る経験値の量とのバランスが非常に悪く、
1時間同じ戦闘を繰り返してレベルが2上がればいいくらい、という設定になっている


・ダンジョンの行き帰りが煩わしい
ダンジョンの途中には親切にワープポイントが設定してあり、そこからダンジョン外に脱出できるようになっているのだが、
ダンジョンから出るとランダムでモンスターたちがワープポイントを占領することがある
占領されるとワープポイントが使用できなくなり、再度ダンジョンの入り口からワープポイントまで直行してモンスターを倒さないといけない
これが非常に面倒臭く、ワープポイントの占領は頻繁に行われる
また、ダンジョンからの帰還の際もこのワープポイントを使用しないと帰れない仕様になっている
前述したこのゲーム独自の「待ち伏せ」システムは待ち伏せすればするほど必要ポイントが増加していく仕様で、これをリセットするには一旦ダンジョンから帰還しないといけないため経験値稼ぎのルーティーンの中に「ダンジョンから帰還」が組み込まれるのだが、そうなると、
1.ダンジョンのワープポイントへワープ
2.待ち伏せポイントへ移動
3.待ち伏せを使用
4.ワープポイントまで移動
5.ダンジョン外へ帰還
という手順を踏む必要があり、一般的なJRPGにおける、ダンジョンの中でならどこでも経験値稼ぎができるゲームと比べると手順の手間がかなり増えているように感じた。

author: {'steamid': '76561197966556534', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 8179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4909, 'last_played': 1561826534}
review:
I don't think I've got very far in the game yet so please ignore my played time, the game has been left on overnight several times. However if you like party-based square-grid tile dungeon crawlers with turn-based combat, like any modern Wizardry game or Etrian Odyssy, this game is up your alley. It includes quality-of-life features like auto-move on the field and fast actions/memorized actions in battle. The story is probably good, I am not the right person to talk about it really because I more care about the dungeon crawling. Anyway, you're the chosen one stranded in a mysterious land who's going to kill all the boss monsters and ???maybe save the world??? it's pretty vague but everyone seems sure something good will happen. You can also choose to ally yourself with one of three different ladies who all want the crystals you get from defeating the boss monsters. You get different powers from them depending on who you decide to give your crystals to. Fairly standard and straightforward stuff, but suffers from pretty mediocre translation.

The dungeon crawling so far is pretty good, but pretty straightforward. No puzzles so far, but there are "unlockable" shortcuts and warp stones. There are rare random battles just walking around, as well as encounters you can see on the field. Battles take place in a separate screen, and each side basically goes simultaneously. You can select actions in any order, but then both sides actions are performed together in order based on stats. Again, pretty standard stuff.

So if everything is pretty standard, why recommend it and why bother buying it? Because it's not well represented on the PC in the west at all, and I do the majority of my gaming on the PC. I like the way this old genre has been reimagined and updated for modern sensibilities and then reimported back to us. This game, while not perfect, isn't objectionable or adult and takes the right lessons from the games its inspired by. The production values are indie-game level and the art available to choose from for characters is of questionable/variable quality. The game itself has been perfectly solid, no crashes or game-stopping bugs. The controls are nice and smooth and worked without rebinding on my 360 controller, although it looks like everything is configurable through an options menu. The game can also be played with keyboard and mouse which works for everything and is sufficient, but one of the benefits of this modern incarnation of the genre is not needing the keyboard and mouse.

The takeaway here is if you like dungeon crawlers like Etrian Odyssey or the modern console Wizardry games, then this is that game on PC. You won't be blown away, but you'll be right at home.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003369814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2175, 'last_played': 1523459675}
review:
Beautiful game with an interesting feel which i just cannot get into.. i tried.

all too often you are cruising through crap mindlessly because the indigenous life is such trash that you mow it down just trying to fill out your mapo when oops.. the encounter that is normally barely noticeable? well this is the exact same monsters just all 10 levels higher for so reason and it looked exactly like the last 17 you mowed through. well damn i guess i better just be more mindful and check everytime anyways.. enter mausoleum of forests where there is an area where the monsters levels are not revealed so now you cannot check.. educated quess? looks just like the last 9 groups i mowed through holding the A button down. nope guess not, one turn in and three characters are dead..

so i suppose the new paradigm is flee from all unknown encounters and pray it works?

I realize they want your characters to die and have to be circulated in and out, but i guess i just feel too invested in the builds i was going to do and going through ambushes/back to town/ ambushes/ etc grinding out gear. it aggravated me when in a single turn someone dies.. there's nothing i can do about it. If these people are disposable trash they should make them feel that way, not like super strong epic heroes of the story. Hell, go disgaea and reward people after bringing enough corpses back for recovery.

well i'm sure some folks enjoy this kind of thing, I wanted a dungeon crawler I could mow through without " alt-f4 and start again from last save " being done more often then getting through a spot like this.

in summation i suppose the problem is the random level spike they throw in occasionally just to screw you over. add to this the fact that sometimes it is completely stealth because they do that whole " hide the monsters name and level " thing at the beginning of encounters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002994039', 'num_games_owned': 1623, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 6446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6446, 'last_played': 1496746171}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011897794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 816, 'last_played': 1521312023}
review:
Uh Oh. 

Before leaving a review, I usually browse through the other reviews and see the percentage of people that share my opinion. In this case, I am one of the very small number of people not recommending this game for the actual gameplay, and not problems getting it to run properly. So here's the with my experience on this one so far:

Problem one. The grinding. 
-Usually I love a good dungeon crawling RPG with lots of grinding and powering up your party. This is one of the top reasons I bought this game. However the combat in this game is crazy. The battles activate randomly as you walk around on the map, and they are too infrequent. I'm 6 hours into the game now, and about 4 of those have been walking in circles to get a battle going. To make things worse, the battles are insanely easy. 90% of the fights, my party doesn't even take a point of damage. I just keep hitting the fastest autobattle button to finish the fights in less than 10 seconds. Wait, if the game is so easy, why don't I just continue to a new area with harder monsters? Well, that takes us to...

Problem two. The balance. 
-Like I said before, my party is so strong I rarely take a hit. Then the next random battle spawns an enemy which is actually pretty challenging. All my characters have ~100hp each, and then I get a guy who hits for 130+ damage in one swing. Continue forward to...

Problem three. The penalty for dying in combat. 
-Ok now I have to check my character in for recovery. It takes "One day" of game time for him to recover. This means I now have to pop in another party member and now go grind with someone new. This already kinda sucks, but it still manages to get worse. Each character has "Life Points" which is represented by 1-3 hearts. When a character dies, they lose a heart. If they die with no hearts left, they vanish forever. At least you can restore hearts....but to do so you have to check your character in for another "Seven days" of game time to get a heart back. Yes. More grinding secondary characters to add to your already painful grind time. And no, there is no way to just go to an inn and pass the seven days. Time only advances while you're out grinding in the dungeon. 

Ok so like I mentioned, I'm only 6 hours in so far. Maybe it's just the first 6 hours that are like this, and I'll soon start unlocking features which turn this into my fave game of all time. Beyond everything that I previously explained, I'm still managing to enjoy it a  bit and have no interest in quitting yet. If that's the case, I'd change my review and just give a warning that the beginning of the game is a bit of a pain. 

Or if you're one of the lovers of this game and feel like I'm just overlooking something and this review is wrong. Let me know in the comments. Thanks!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006222498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 2287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2081, 'last_played': 1527982832}
review:
One of those old-school dungeon crawlers that makes you forget you played it for 5 hours straight. I picked it up when it came out, but barely scratched the surface of it. I then started playing Might and Magic 3 recently. I got hooked on it again. I then saw this title in my library and thought I should give it another shot. Am I glad that I did.

Lots of fighting, lots of grinding, lots of loot (and with a unique yet interesting system to get it), and a bit of running. It's right in the vein of older series of dungeon crawlers like Wizardy, and Might and Magic. It's definitely not like newer rpgs, where basically every encounter is winnable. 

Character creation has some interesting things to it. Mostly with setting the age of the character. Young characters have the most life points with 3 (he/she loses 1 point each time they fall in battle), but very little bonus points to distribute when created. On the other hand, the old characters have the most attribute points at creation, yet only have 1 life point. So if they die, they're dead for good.

You'll be swapping party members on a regular basis, as characters get injured and need to rest. The good thing is, your reserve characters still gain some xp while not in your party, so they don't lag too far behind. They also generate a bit of income as well. Just make sure to check their equipment!

All in all, if you like grindy, loot-filled, hard-mode rpgs, then pick this one up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198343746367', 'num_games_owned': 2177, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 3318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3318, 'last_played': 1513241031}
review:
on the surface, stranger of sword city looks like most typical dungeon crawlers, and perhaps in many ways, it is. for those of you who are expecting something in the vein of 'legend of grimrock', you might be a bit disappointed. but if you are expecting something closer to the vein of 'wizardry', then you're in luck.

stranger of sword city has a heavy focus on combat, and as such, creating characters that would serve your party well, and planning skills for each character to use in combat. in terms of exploration however, there's only so many dungeons, and not too many 'hidden' areas that arent obvious to the player.

playing through the game however, you will be entertained by brilliantly done visuals (which you can also customize if you so wish), and interesting looking places (although limited). the soundtrack can get a bit repetitive, but it's not all bad however.

what keeps a player going, and playing or replaying the game, would be mostly about experimentation on the different (albeit a bit limited) classes, and their skills. the drawback however, being that some classes are just a bit too powerful, and would almost certainly be cycled into most characters' class changes.

the story isnt too bad either. it starts off sounding pretty corny, but it is fairly interesting, and it comes with multiple endings, which should give enough initiative for some players to replay it a few times.

all in all, it's a game that might take a while for you to really sink your teeth into, experimenting with classes and skills, and probably screwing up your builds a few times before getting it right. but once you get going, it can get pretty fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031190155', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 7494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7352, 'last_played': 1516069407}
review:
Okay, let's try and keep this short

The main problem here is the lack of any sort of end game. Classes get pretty lack luster skills, and because there is no stamina system, they have to be gimped in some way to avoid being OP, but, OP is fun, hitting 6 times after concentrating for one round at 1/2 accuracy isn't.

At first you see that class change system and think "oh can't wait to build some cool min/max type stuff", but you literally need maybe 5/6 skills that every character needs, and they will suit whatever role perfectly, just throw them back into their original class once you have them. With the lack of high level, fun skills leveling up because pointless except to keep up with random encounters, since you can brutally alter hit/dodge points through triple casting.

So in the end you have high level, everything classed characters whom don't really feel all that different from when you maxed your first class. The progress drops sharply once you picked up a few abilities, and every boss comes down to "spam avoid till 99, spam damage" with some tactical choice in between.

So if it's cheap, i could say get it and beat it once, but it's not really a memorable experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133502762', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 8609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8609, 'last_played': 1490329970}
review:
很棒的rpg游戏，就是没有官方汉化o(╯□╰)o
迷宫探索和游戏风格都不错，丰富的职业和不同技能相互组合以及各种战术的配合，去探索发现丰富多彩世界的体验很棒！

-------------------------------

author: {'steamid': '76561198335518276', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1612535013}
review:
很有趣的游戏，如果你喜欢这类DRPG，特别是前作圆桌骑士团的话会觉得这游戏不错。另外steam上是原版，我推荐各位有psv的话尽量玩psv上的新释。
给新手一点建议，这游戏死亡惩罚很大，别冒险。人物不要只有6个，建议至少练8个，方便轮换，我是练了10个人，还有6个人选freeman（新释新加职业），用满16个名额
命中非常非常重要，物理攻击类角色尽量堆命中，打boss的时候自己的辅助多用群体加命中的魔法。如果你不能确定职业的话，那就骑士战士武士+医生法师舞者，这套阵容不转职也能打到至少剧情结束。回城道具不能无限买，省着点用，反正有自动移动，如果近的话走回城就好了。
才能我建议选不屈的身体以及无才之人（新释加的）其他都不推荐。
最后吐槽一下，这游戏居然不能在迷宫里存档，我的意思是说迷宫里的那种中断存档都没有，真的很坑爹。

author: {'steamid': '76561198188748931', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 6253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3861, 'last_played': 1533481558}

author: {'steamid': '76561198208277580', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1522225948}
review: 一款少有的drpg游戏，精美的立绘，游戏本身不错，就是难度太高，而且有闪退问题，每次更新后最好重新安装一下汉化补丁
